Who are we?
Thesis, a digital agency in Portland, OR. We’re hell-bent on humanizing the relationship between people and brands, which starts with our teams: real people making real work. Come as you are. Bring what you bring. We’ve been around for 20 years. In contrast to our former identity that reflected what we do, we chose the name Thesis as it better represents how we do it: a full-service agency believing our strength is in our approach—believing how the work we make is only as strong as the thought—and data—we put behind it. That sounds intense. But make no mistake, we also play real hard.

The Junior Developer - Web is an entry level technical position who works directly with the Director of Technology and the Technology team. The Junior Developer - Web supports the Technology team with designing, developing and maintaining various technical projects for our clients needs including websites, web applications, HTML email, and custom software solutions
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Investigate, analyze and make recommendations to the team regarding technology improvements, upgrades and modifications
Participate in team activities such as status meetings and code reviews
Help estimate and plan work during planning meetings
Self-directed learning and study
Create and/or assist in the development of layout of email templates and web experiences by using standard HTML/CSS practices
Write well designed, testable and efficient code by using best development practices
Pair with senior developers to learn advanced skills
Collaborate with partners across disciplines when creating deliverables. EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
1-2 years of professional work experience or other relevant life experience
Any knowledge of computer programming is a plus
KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

Basic knowledge of web technologies and standards is a plus
Proficiency in graphic design tools is a plus
Demonstrated problem identification and creative problem solving skills
Attention to detail and good organizational skills
Ability to work on multiple tasks and switch between them quickly
Excellent time management skills and experience delivering projects in a deadline-driven environment
Critically, be hungry to learn and grow beyond this job description.


Still with us?

Cool! Let’s talk.

———

Workplace equity is not a single checkbox.

It’s a new way of thinking, of working, and of moving through the world. At Thesis, we prioritize diversity, equity, and inclusion. You’ll see this in our hiring practices, growth plans,

and workplace programs—because our agency, our work, and our society are better when diverse perspectives come together.

LYRASIS is looking for a collaborative application developer to participate in the day-to-day maintenance, ongoing development, and community activities of the open-source Fedora application.
Fedora is a digital preservation-focused repository platform for managing and disseminating digital content. Fedora relies on Java primarily and other systems, such as relational databases. Fedora is stable, has just finished a major release, and is primarily in an adoption/maintenance phase. The program is supported by an active community of Fedora users, including code committers and technologists from multiple partner organizations. The ideal candidate will be excited at the opportunity to dive into this field and learn more about the software and the community it serves
This is a remote, part-time position (approximately 20 hours per week) with the potential to grow into a full-time role.
Duties/Job Responsibilities:
Initial expectations for the successful candidate will focus on maintenance and support of the system with the possibility for further feature-based development in the future. The person in this position:
designs, implements, tests, and supports the Fedora application
works with community partners to address their business needs while coordinating with other community developers, the program manager, subject matter experts, and stakeholders
coordinates software quality assurance and technical documentation for major releases
provides technical support to users, troubleshooting problems, and maintaining code
Skills and Qualifications:
2 years with an OO based language such as Java (or a combination of related education and experience)
Knowledge of database programming, especially open source (PostgreSQL, MySQL)
Familiarity with working collaboratively and communicating effectively with stakeholders
Experience working with a cross-functional team to plan and complete technical projects
Experience with version control (e.g., Git/Github)
Understanding of standard web specifications (REST, HTTP), incident, problem, change, and release management practices
Effective oral and written communication skills, including producing technical documentation
Ability to troubleshoot application, database, network, and operating system-related issues
Ability to work independently and excel in time management, organization, and prioritization
Preferred Qualifications
agile development methodologies
search and indexing platforms such as Apache Solr or ElasticSearch
server-side web development using Java and JEE technologies, Ruby, and/or Python
test-driven development and/or continuous integration
cloud-deployment
containerized development (e.g., Docker)
application and web service development for museums, libraries, archives, or digital collections
Interest in participating in user-facing events such as demos, training videos, and/or community meetings
The position is part of a geographically and institutionally distributed team, and, as such, applications from candidates interested in telecommuting are welcome. North American time zones preferred
You should apply even if you do not feel that your credentials are a 100% match with the position description. We are looking for relevant skills and experience, not a checklist that exactly matches the position itself.
To Apply: All applications MUST be submitted with a cover letter for consideration.
Applications are accepted until the position is filled but the review of applications will begin on August 29, 2022
About Us:
Fedora has its organizational home at LYRASIS, 501(c)(3) non-profit membership organization whose mission is to support enduring access to the world's shared academic, scientific, and cultural heritage through leadership in open technologies, content services, digital solutions and collaboration with archives, libraries, museums, and knowledge communities worldwide.

At LYRASIS, one of our core values is to provide an inclusive environment to all who are employed here. Therefore, the company is intentional in providing fair and equitable employment opportunities to all applicants, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. We are looking for an outstanding Web Developer to be responsible for the coding, innovative design and layout of client websites.

Web developer responsibilities include building websites from provided visual concepts all the way to completion from the bottom up, fashioning everything from the home page to site layout and functionality.

Responsibilities

Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices as needed
Utilize and MUST be familiar with WordPress and Elementor including other WordPress plugins
Create a website layout/user interface by using standard HTML/CSS practices
Integrate data from various back-end services and databases
Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs
Create and maintain software documentation
Be responsible for maintaining, expanding, and scaling our site
Stay plugged into emerging technologies/industry trends and apply them into operations and activities
Cooperate with web designers to match visual design intent

Requirements

Proven working experience in web programming
MUST have experience with WordPress development and Elementor
Top-notch programming skills and in-depth knowledge of modern HTML/CSS
Familiarity with at least one of the following programming languages: PHP, ASP.NET, Javascript or Ruby on Rails
A solid understanding of how web applications work including security, session management, and best development practices
Adequate knowledge of relational database systems, Object Oriented Programming and web application development
Hands-on experience with network diagnostics, network analytics tools
Basic knowledge of Search Engine Optimization process
Aggressive problem diagnosis and creative problem-solving skills
Strong organizational skills to juggle multiple tasks within the constraints of timelines and budgets with business acumen
Ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly and master diverse web technologies and techniques
BS in computer science or a related field preferred but not required

Location:

This position is 100% remote.

 We are looking for an outstanding Web Developer to be responsible for the coding, innovative design and layout of client websites.

Responsibilities

Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices as needed
Utilize and MUST be familiar with WordPress and Elementor including other WordPress plugins
Create a website layout/user interface by using standard HTML/CSS practices
Integrate data from various back-end services and databases
Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs
Create and maintain software documentation
Be responsible for maintaining, expanding, and scaling our site
Stay plugged into emerging technologies/industry trends and apply them into operations and activities
Cooperate with web designers to match visual design intent

Requirements

Proven working experience in web programming
MUST have experience with WordPress development and Elementor
Top-notch programming skills and in-depth knowledge of modern HTML/CSS
Familiarity with at least one of the following programming languages: PHP, ASP.NET, Javascript or Ruby on Rails
A solid understanding of how web applications work including security, session management, and best development practices
Adequate knowledge of relational database systems, Object Oriented Programming and web application development
Hands-on experience with network diagnostics, network analytics tools
Basic knowledge of Search Engine Optimization process
Aggressive problem diagnosis and creative problem-solving skills
Strong organizational skills to juggle multiple tasks within the constraints of timelines and budgets with business acumen
Ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly and master diverse web technologies and techniques
BS in computer science or a related field preferred but not required

Location:

This position is 100% remote.

Emphasys Housing Locator (HL), a wholly owned subsidiary of Constellation Software (TSX: CSU), is hiring a Front-End Developer to join our team and help us build great products for the leading online marketplace and technology solutions provider for the US affordable housing industry.


What You'll Be Doing:

Build out strong UI/UX improvements throughout our product suite, and in particular our flagship product
Update and improve the core SaaS web application used by external customers
Contribute to the creation of our next-generation functionality offered to customers
Communicate and work well with everyone in our team, including sales, support, management, and other developers
Conduct unit testing and other code reviews
Provide development estimates of the new features and improvements
Participate in testing as required
Ability to diagnose problems as they arise and then design and develop solutions to exceed user expectations
Review requirements specifications and identify gaps and inconsistencies
Participate in Agile-based iteration and SCRUM meetings

2 - 5+ years of experience building web applications
Experience with HTML5/CSS3 and JavaScript
Familiar with modern accessibility guidelines
Product and UI/UX design
Experience with Adobe and/or other design tools
Some base familiarity and knowledge of Python
Strong communication skills
Capable of rapid knowledge acquisition
Team spirit
Good problem-solving skills
BSc in Computer Science, Engineering, or relevant field

Access to Medical, Vision, Dental, & Life Insurance
Competitive Bonus & Profit Sharing Program
Fortune 500 Level 401(k)

Tuition Reimbursement Program


Why Emphasys?
Owned by Constellation Software, Inc., the leading global provider of industry-specific software solutions, Emphasys has decades of leadership in this market, we are well-positioned to deliver our solutions across the nation.

Housing Locator makes software that helps governments, housing finance agencies, and other housing and social service organizations locate affordable and special needs housing in their communities, find housing for people with special needs, and so much more.

Joining Emphasys means joining a global network of 17,000+ employees, with numerous career development and advancement opportunities. Our team is growing, and we are looking for the highest quality talent to join us on our journey.

US & international applications are accepted. Must be able to work within Eastern Time.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Welcome to Marbella Lane. We’re an inclusive and welcoming company located in Brisbane, California, and we’re in the business of providing beautiful places and spaces that serve as a haven for families and friends. We are proud to have obtained Airbnb Super Host status and are continually adding new properties to our portfolio.

Here at Marbella Lane, we believe in supporting the learning and growth of each team member. Our commitment to you, should you be chosen to join our team, is to help guide you as you get up to speed on the technologies in our stack and provide space for you to learn any new technologies as they come along during our development process.

This position could be your dream job if:

You possess front-end development experience
You excel in a remote position working collaboratively with a virtual team
You’re excited about joining a supportive company offering exceptional vacation rental properties.

POSITION SUMMARY:

Currently, we’re seeking a full-time JS Front-End Developer who excels working in a remote environment alongside a virtual team using the platforms GitHub, Slack and Monday.com

To be successful as our Front-End Developer, it will be crucial for you to be a strong work ethic and work well independently as well as collaboratively. This position will require you to constantly upgrade your skills with a desire to step out and stretch your capabilities. You will also need to consistently meet deadlines, stay accountable and accurately report your progress.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Build out the framework for website themes.
Build components and API integrations for rapidly growing websites, micro-sites, and services.
Work collaboratively with other team members.
Ensure that all sites and components work well with best SEO practices.
Manage multiple projects at a time and meet deadlines.
Constant interaction with other team members, technical and non-technical, to discuss UI ideas and functionality.

QUALIFICATIONS:

2+ years experience in React JS framework, Jamstack, headless CMS, HTML5, CSS, JSON
Front-end development experience is a must.
Documentation skills for application updates, guidelines, and best practices
Knowledge of SEO is a plus.
Mobile optimization and API integration experience are desired.
Able to create a responsive design to fit any device
Creative and analytical
Experience in website theme development
Known for being equally creative and analytical in how to approach design

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:

Hourly: $40.00 - $45.00 / hour COMPANY OVERVIEW:

The mission of The New York Times is to seek the truth and help people understand the world. That means independent journalism is at the heart of all we do as a company. It’s why we have a newsroom that’s 1,700 strong and sends journalists to report on the ground from nearly 160 countries. It’s why we focus deeply on how our readers will experience our journalism, from print to audio to a world-class digital and app destination. And it’s why our business strategy centers on making journalism so good that it’s worth paying for.
Note for US based roles: Any offer of employment is contingent on providing proof of Covid-19 vaccination prior to your start date, subject to approved medical and/or religious exemptions, in accordance with applicable law.
New York Times
New York City, NY
Your Team:
You will join a team of specialists who support all marketing emails and landing page initiatives for the Standalone Products group: NYT Cooking, NYT Games, Audio, Wirecutter and more. In addition to setting up and launching these assets, your team is an advisor to our marketing and creative groups, on email and landing page best practices.
About the Role:
You will be responsible for developing and deploying front-end creative to support a segmented content strategy to drive conversion. An ideal candidate is deeply familiar with HTML, CSS and JavaScript best practices for targeted experiences. You will have had prior experience in email marketing , and be ready to jump into everything from coding responsive HTML emails to executing campaigns. You should have familiarity in building and executing campaigns via a Content Management System (CMS) and/or personalization tools. You are innovative, efficient and highly collaborative with an unyielding focus on beating goals through iterative learning.
Responsibilities:
Gather requirements, test deliverability, prepare and deploy campaigns using Responsys' platform
Deploy marketing assets to desktop and mobile properties via content management platforms, using HTML, CSS and ReactJS
Maintain best practices for email campaigns & landing pages, and make recommendations
Manage successful and accurate deployment of all assets, to ensure campaign performance and support A/B testing projects
Manage to execution deadlines and maintenance
Troubleshoot and debug collaboratively to resolve coding and trafficking issues
Track early post-launch campaign activities, and resolve delivery and any performance problems related to setup
Required:
4+ years of email deployment and coding experience, Responsys Preferred
1+ years of experience in front-end web development, including debugging skills
Experience translating technical explanations to non-technical users
Excellent client service approach and can effectively handle multiple projects
Thrive in a collaborative, team environment
Familiarity with website content management systems such as Magnolia, Optimizely, BlueKai, etc.
Knowledge of creative A/B testing, media formats and internet technologies
#LI-AM1
The New York Times is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce, one that reflects the varied global community we serve. Our journalism and the products we build in the service of that journalism greatly benefit from a range of perspectives, which can only come from diversity of all types, across our ranks, at all levels of the organization. Achieving true diversity and inclusion is the right thing to do. It is also the smart thing for our business. So we strongly encourage women, veterans, people with disabilities, people of color and gender nonconforming candidates to apply.
The New York Times Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual's sex, age, race, color, creed, national origin, alienage, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation or affectional preference, gender identity and expression, disability, genetic trait or predisposition, carrier status, citizenship, veteran or military status and other personal characteristics protected by law. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected characteristics. The New York Times Company will consider qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local "Fair Chance" laws. We are looking for a .Net C# Web Programmer/Developer who is passionate about building professional web sites and applications that create a positive brand experience.The programmer/developer will be responsible for all phases of development and will play a significant role in enhancing and improving the user experience across web and application platforms.Seeking a .Net C# programmer/developer who will help us to develop and maintain our in-house proprietary ordering system. This system allows our sales force to build fully customized products from scratch, visually, place and track the orders once they are completed, and provide our sales force with the most up-to-date reporting within their regions. This is a state of the art, one-of-a-kind system with many challenges to push your skills and knowledge of .Net to its limits!ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES1. Ability to develop applications and backend services using C#, ASP.NET, Java Script, jQuery, and CSS. Strong SQL skills are a must.2. Interact regularly with internal users to address issues with current software. Continuously evaluate our ordering system, the Pukka websites, and other digital tools and provide suggestions for improvement.3. Work with and maintain previously developed projects.4. Develop scalable, web-based applications.5. Testing and debugging new code before it is published to end users.6. Diagram and document the processes/programs you have worked on.7. Continually work to stay up to date on current developments and best practices in client-side technologies.QUALIFICATIONS / EDUCATION: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or ability required:1. 2 - 5 Years of experience as a .NET Developer working on Web Application development using C# with .NET 4.0/4.5 Framework or .net core.2. Expertise and hands on experience with Web Applications and programming languages such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, SVG and API's.3. Back-end development utilizing SQL 2008-2012. Candidate needs to have a strong experience with stored procedures, tables and joins.4. Functional knowledge or hands on experience with Web Services (REST, SOAP, etc...) is needed to be successful in this position.5. Working knowledge of graphic design tools such as Sketch, Photoshop, and Illustrator is a plus.6. Must be self-directed and capable of setting priorities independently.7. Willingness to constantly learn new technologies to complete current assignments.8. Must have the ability to thrive in a fast paced, rapidly changing and growing, entrepreneurial environment.9. Ability to communicate clearly and concisely both verbally and with the written word.10. Ability to exercise good judgement and have excellent decision-making and problem-solving skills.Job Type: Full-timePay: $100,000.00 - $140,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payCOVID-19 considerations:Remote acceptable but 1-3 days onsite preferred. This system allows our sales force to build fully customized products from scratch, visually, place and track the orders once they are completed, and provide our sales force with the most up-to-date reporting within their regions. This is a state of the art, one-of-a-kind system with many challenges to push your skills and knowledge of .Net to its limits!ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES1. WHO WE ARE
Founded in 1983, Medical Review Institute of America (MRIoA) is the market leader for technology-enabled utilization management and clinical medical review solutions. We have an outstanding reputation for excellence and achieve continual improvement. At MRIoA we believe our employees are the key to our success. Here you are more than just a cog in the machine - you are a valued member of our family.
WE OFFER
A team atmosphere with fun events and prizes!
Growth and training opportunities.
Benefits including great medical, vision, and dental insurances, a huge 401k match, a profit sharing bonus, vacation and personal time, and paid holidays.
GETTING DOWN TO BRASS TACKS
The Web Developer position will join a bright, talented, and creative dev team reporting to the Web Development Supervisor. You will create and improve our web applications and APIs.
Anticipated schedule is Monday - Friday, eight hours a day.
Company headquarters are located in Salt Lake City, but this position is fully remote and relocation is not required.
YOUR JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Design, code, test, document and debug our web applications according to industry best practices
Find and fix software defects
Help define scope and specifications for software projects
Present ideas for software improvements, including time/cost estimates
Research and recommend improved development tools, algorithms, and processes
YOUR BACKGROUND
High school diploma (or equivalent) required
Bachelor's degree (or equivalent experience) preferred
2+ years experience with JavaScript
2+ years experience in web development, layout and design (CSS & HTML)
HELPFUL SKILLS
Full-stack web development (Back-end: Node.js, Front-end: React or Angular)
Test automation and unit tests
Agile/Lean software development
DevOps experience (e.g. CI/CD automation)
Cloud computing services (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)
Mobile app development (React Native)
Git
SQL databases and queries
Microsoft SQL Server (T-SQL)
ORMs (e.g. Sequelize)
ColdFusion (CFML) and ColdBox
Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
MRIoA is a drug-free workplace. All candidates are required to pass a Background Screen before beginning employment. All newly hired employees will take a Drug Screen, as well as agreeing to all necessary Compliance Regulations on their first day of employment. WHO WE ARE

If you are a Jr. PHP Developer with experience, please read on! Located in Tampa, Fl. we are the software division of the Fest Corporation Family of Companies which include American Marketing and Mailing and American Visual Brands.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

You get to work with other top talent Developers who value the same principles as you do. We encourage learning new techniques, sharing your knowledge with others and invest in the training to get you to the next level. We’re an equal opportunity employer providing a fun but respectful environment to work in. We strive to make your role both challenging and rewarding.

What You Will Be Doing

The role is for a Senior Developer to help lead the Web Team into the next generation of web content delivery. We’re looking for someone with experience with multiple frameworks and languages who can quickly learn and understand our code base, help identify architecture and performance improvements, and can drive a transition plan to get there while continuing to improve our user experience.

What You Need for this Position

Experience: 1+ yrs PHP software development
With the following languages/frameworks: PHP/ Symfony, Javascript, CSS, HTML

What’s In It for You

For your hard work we are offering a competitive salary benefits and vacation!
Dress is Jeans casual with periodic employee team building activities.
So, if you are a Jr. PHP Developer with experience, please apply today!

job_title: Academic Part Time Mars Public Engagement Web Developer
listing_jobDesc:
Job Details
New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.
Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.
The applicant selected will be an Academic Part-Time Undergraduate Student and will report to the Mars Public Engagement manager. Will be provided with hands-on work experience in website development and maintenance. Will help maintain the mars.nasa.gov website content, and write scripts with various programming languages. Will enable web development through research and ongoing review of existing and new software and hardware technologies.
Will perform the following duties as a member of the Mars Exploration Public Engagement team:
Performs routine job functions and activities within assigned area.
Posts and maintains content on Mars-related web sites following accessibility standards
Uses selected content management systems and update sites accordingly
Develops new ideas to keep site up to date with changing technologies and web trends
Assists in gathering and analyzing site metrics
Works within the boundaries of standard procedure using basic publication software and content management tools.
Participates in writing script to enable web content presentation using technologies such as MySQL databases, client side scripting (ColdFusion, PHP, Python, Ruby, JavaScript, etc.), and various JavaScript libraries and frameworks.
May participate in the creation or light editing of communication products for general audiences including content for internal and external websites or social media sites.
Works on day-to-day assignments under direct supervision; receives detailed instructions on new assignments.
Uses applicable policies, procedures and practices as guides to determine work methods and deliver results.
Work is reviewed for accuracy and overall adequacy.
Seeks guidance in applying applicable policies, procedures and practices to new situations to determine appropriate action.
Interacts primarily with immediate task lead and team members within own organization.
Develops and tests code for web and mobile application using modern methods of development.
Able to troubleshoot, diagnose and resolve application issues.
Qualifications:
Required Skills:
Must be currently enrolled at least half-time at an accredited college or university pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related discipline.
Must be able to work a minimum of 15 hours per week, with a maximum of 30 hours per week while in school.
Minimum GPA 3.0
Has some familiarity in one or more of the following areas: Technical capabilities in Java, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, MySQL, SQL, and responsive design.
Completed coursework with exposure to standard principles, theories, concepts and techniques in Web Support.
Proficient Microsoft Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Punctual, detail oriented, resourceful and a self-motivated individual.
A self-starter with the ability to work independently and apply judgment in planning, prioritizing, and completing tasks.
Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to work in a team environment.
Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks with a strong attention to detail. Strong problem solving, critical thinking and analytical skills.
Desired Skills:
Prefer Sophomore or Junior
Prior internship experience in related programming and/or information technology areas
Participation in student organizations
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Photoshop.
Ability to interface with all levels of personnel and the ability to resolve multifaceted issues.
Highly organized individual that is detail oriented and able to multi-task and complete assignments.
Graphic design aptitude and experience with some website development or maintenance.
Skills in web-based development, including REST APIs and JS frameworks such as VueJS/Angular/React.
Knowledge in AWS cloud services
JPL is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy or perceived pregnancy, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, protected military or veteran status or any other characteristic or condition protected by Federal, state or local law.
In addition, JPL is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.
EEO is the Law.
EEO is the Law Supplement
Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision
The Jet Propulsion Laboratory is a federal facility. Due to rules imposed by NASA, JPL will not accept applications from citizens of designated countries or those born in a designated country unless they are Legal Permanent Residents of the U.S or have other protected status under 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3). The Designated Countries List is available here. Job Details

Are you ready for a career you can BELIEVE in?
Do you have a strong belief in the 2nd Amendment?
Do you support the natural-born right to armed self-defense?
Do you believe in the mission of the U.S. Concealed Carry Association (USCCA)?
The USCCA helps responsible Americans avoid danger, save lives, and keep their families safe.
Delta Defense, LLC is the private company that provides Marketing, Operations and Customer Service for the USCCA.
Why YOU should Work at Delta Defense!
We are a fun, fast-paced, and rewarding place to work and grow!
Milwaukee Business Journal “Best Place to Work” award 6 years in a row!
Named on Inc. 5000 “Fastest Growing Private Companies” list 10 years in a row!
Milwaukee Journal Sentinel “Top Workplace” award 7 years in a row!
Top Workplaces USA award in 2022!
Position Summary:
The eCommerce Web Developer will be responsible for the coding, innovative design and layout of the USCCA Store website. With so many unique internal and external customers to satisfy, you’ll enjoy a wide range of exposure to different challenges that need solving. This isn’t rinse and repeat development; we are in the trenches developing the future of the company in an environment with generous levels of autonomy.
This is a new position with primary focus on supporting our on-line store. Collaborate with cross functional teammates and take our growth in this space to new heights. Be a part of inventing new features that create customer happiness and increase our e-commerce footprint. If you are a results-driven perfectionist with a bias for action, this could be your dream job!
Responsibilities:
Design, build, and maintain applications and webpages for our e-commerce applications.
Write clean, efficient and scalable code.
Work to continually improve our processes, tools, standards, and team.
Debug complicated issues that touch many services.
Research improvements and enhancements to be made within e-commerce. Resolve current application flaws affecting the USCCA Store guest experience.
Stay abreast of internet market trends, eCommerce methods, cross browser functionality, promotional trends and always be bringing opportunities and new ideas forward.
Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong follow-through, and attention to detail.
Facilitate, collaborate and drive projects forward as you neutralize barriers for yourself and your team.
All other duties as assigned.
Required Skills/Experience:
High school diploma or equivalent is required.
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology/Business or related field is preferred. In lieu of a degree, equivalent work experience will be considered.
4+ years development experience of business or technical applications.
Experience with JavaScript frameworks (i.e. Angular, jQuery, Node.js, React).
Strong front-end development experience of web-based applications using HTML, Advanced JavaScript, and CSS/SASS.
Experience with Gulp, Webpack, Grunt, or NPM.
Strong understanding of UI/UX focusing on the elegance of user interaction with "Pixel Perfect" attention to detail.
Familiarity with Headless CMS.
Good understanding of SEO principles
Experience with Object-Oriented Programming.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and remain cool amidst changing business priorities.
Strong independent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively to meet rapid deadlines.
Demonstrates the Core Values of Delta Defense, LLC.
Benefits information can be reviewed at: https://www.deltadefense.com/careers
If you are a Colorado resident, please email us at recruiting@uscca.com to receive complete benefits and compensation information. Please include the job title in the subject line of the email.
*Please watch your email for next steps after submitting your application. You will be asked to take an online assessment in order to complete the application process. We look forward to your application.*

#LI-Remote Show more

Overview:

Suttle-Straus is looking for an Application Developer I to join our award winning team. Winner of the Printing Industries of America’s Best Workplace award for 20 consecutive years, we offer a collaborative work environment, great benefits and fantastic co-workers. The ideal candidate has a desire to learn and knowledge of one or more of the following: C#, ASP.NET, PHP/Zend Framework, SQL Server, MySQL, JavaScript, XML/XSLT and/or HTML/CSS. This is an entry level position with a pay range starting at $21 per hour.
Suttle-Straus is a premier provider of printing, wide format, digital imaging, mailing, custom kitting, warehousing, and distribution services. Our success is founded on three core principles: A clear focus on meeting and exceeding customer expectations; a long history of implementing new technologies to increase quality and efficiency; and the importance of building an outstanding workforce. We offer a competitive benefits package with immediate eligibility for health, dental, vision and life insurance, and eligibility after 30 days for a company matched 401(k) plan. Paid time off accrues monthly from date of hire.

Responsibilities:

Job Summary:
The Application Developer I is responsible for the design, development, deployment, and technical support of web applications, custom software solutions, database systems, and management information systems. Through developing knowledge of key systems and industry concepts, the Application Developer I provides support and solutions in the areas of application development and tier 3 support. This role is developing skills for programming languages and technology systems to enhance solutions to meet client and internal needs.
Key Responsibility Areas:
1. Design and Develop Customer and Internal Application Systems
Understands client requirements and how to translate into application features and deployment
Collaborates with team to provide input for requirements, time estimates and report progress
Executes design, build, test and deployment of technology solutions (web applications, system integrations, analytics, etc.) with the support of team members
Analyzes and resolves issues associated with deployed solutions working with application developers
Resolves routine issues and support in finding a solution
Supports and enhances solutions building upon development platforms
Conducts quality assurance and testing of developed solutions to ensure strong functionality and optimization
2. Monitor and Improve Processes Related to Software Development Life Cycle
Supports the continued development of architectural diagrams, standards, technical design and operational support documentation
Participates in providing input toward solution roadmaps and application life cycles
Contributes to process standardization related to source control, change management, and other aspects of software development and deployment
Continued learning of new methods, enhancements and functionalities as they pertain to support of existing systems and other related internal business automation tools
Responsible for testing and correcting bugs found before and after launch
Other Job Duties:
Provides ongoing tier 3 technology support for internal and external customers
Provides support for level 1 and 2 support structures including training when appropriate
May require participation in on-call support
Qualifications:

Skills & Educational Requirements:
Degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering, or related discipline, and/or 1-2 years of development experience
Analytical mindset and a keen eye for detail
Ability to resolve routine issues and problems
Developing knowledge of C#, ASP.NET, PHP/Zend Framework, SQL Server, MySQL, JavaScript, XML/XSLT, and HTML/CSS a plus
Familiarity with Agile team-based application development practices and tools, such as version control, SVN, Git, JIRA, Agile/Scrum/Kanban is a plus
Basic understanding of general industry concepts and technologies, including networking, security, Windows server, web servers (IIS/Apache), XML, web-service based APIs Overview:

We are looking for a talented, hungry and driven web developer to join our growing team. Our agency creates websites, funnels and landing pages for eCommerce and Lead Generation clients across a wide variety of industries.You would work closely with our design team to develop beautiful, high-converting web pages that will work well in tandem with our paid and organic marketing and advertising efforts. We're looking for someone who's developed 100s of websites and landing pages over their career.This would start off as a Contract role, but we would look to transition you into a full-time role over the next 3-6 months.ResponsibilitiesWork in a fast-paced cross-functional collaborative team environment, designing and building customer-facing eCommerce and Lead Generation websites for a wide variety of industries using WordPress, Shopify and Unbounce.Work with our design team to rapidly develop, test, deploy, and scale websites.Collaborating with content management teams to ensure that the website aligns with brand strategy and meets the organization’s standards.Provide strategic technical recommendations on implementing A/B testing.Install effective and reliable event tracking to provide the team with insights on key conversion points across the sites you develop.Integrate with various APIs to provide features and functionality for websites, funnels and landing pages.Effectively communicate technical needs, timelines, risks and blockers.Identify optimization opportunities with existing front-end designs.Promptly resolve website issues and document changes.Deliver exceptional client results and project success.Learn the client’s business, their organization, systems, challenges and goals.Code review other developers work and suggest improvements when needed.Improve the user experience of the client’s website regularly.Keeping up to date with industry best practices and monitoring competitor websites.QualificationsYou are highly interested in the end result of the sites and pages that you develop, which is the results it produces for our clients in tandem with our paid advertising strategies.You constantly learn new things and stay on top of all new things that come up within the web development industry.You are comfortable testing and re-testing your code to make sure no bugs make it into production. Job Description:
Experience in using languages to writing code such as (and not limited to) JavaScript (JS);
Understanding in Python script programming and front-end technologies, such as HTML5, bootstrap, and CSS3;
Understanding of the differences between multiple delivery platforms, such as mobile vs desktop, and optimizing output to match the specific platform.
Requirement:
Singaporean or PR, Diploma/Degree in Computer Science or related field (Fresh graduate is welcome);
Min 1-2 years and above experience in related field is an advantage;
Experience in GIS professional is an advantage;
Any programming projects would be an advantage;
Able to work independently with minimal supervision;
Native English language, fluency in Mandarin (both spoken and written) is an advantage.
You will work with a GIS professional team which can learn different type of skill about Geographical information system and Geo-spatial data analysis.
If you are keen to join our team, please forward your details resume to “Apply Now”. We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.
Company Overview：
One GIS is founded in 2012 by providing the best service to serve customers all over South East Asia and China. Our commitment is to provide professional service in GIS and related industries, including site investigation,strata survey, geology, geo-technic, urban planning, monitoring, UAV survey and 3D modelling. We also provides complete solutions with GIS and Laser Scanning technologies includes Virtual City Modelling with mobile mapping system, large heritage site reconstruction and so on.

Job Description:
Experience in using languages to writing code such as (and not limited to) JavaScript (JS);
Understanding in Python script programming and front-end technologies, such as HTML5, bootstrap, and CSS3;
Understanding of the differences between multiple delivery platforms, such as mobile vs desktop, and optimizing output to match the specific platform.
Requirement:
Singaporean or PR, Diploma/Degree in Computer Science or related field (Fresh graduate is welcome);
Min 1-2 years and above experience in related field is an advantage;
Experience in GIS professional is an advantage;
Any programming projects would be an advantage;
Able to work independently with minimal supervision;
Native English language, fluency in Mandarin (both spoken and written) is an advantage.
You will work with a GIS professional team which can learn different type of skill about Geographical information system and Geo-spatial data analysis.
If you are keen to join our team, please forward your details resume to “Apply Now”. We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

Our company, National Retail Solutions (NRS), is a wholly-owned subsidiary of IDT Corporation – a telecom company with many products and divisions including its famed Boss Revolution international calling products sold in 10’s thousands of stores, and its Net2Phone Office hosted PBX offering.
NRS is revolutionizing the independent retail industry by providing them with cost-effective, state of the art point sale systems and complementary services such as a store management app, consumer ordering app, web storefront for merchants, and loyalty programs allowing small retailers to more effectively compete with the larger store chains and online merchants. We are deployed in well over 14 thousand stores across the US at this time.
The technology division is a small, high-powered development group with teams situated in the US, Israel, and Minsk that produces interactive, high-performance web applications that are both good-looking and easy to use.
Our development team is in search of a candidate to develop the front ends of several of our applications, both for customer-facing and internal websites.
Required Skills & Experience
Professional experience in a frontend or full-stack development role
Professional experience with a modern JavaScript framework (e.g. Vue, Angular, React) - Vue.js preferred
Serves as a client advocate to implement a user-friendly experience
Ability to work effectively both individually and in a team environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including producing wireframe mockups
Ability to interact professionally with a diverse group: clients, executives, managers, and coworkers
Working knowledge of AWS services
Experience with GitHub, Jira
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
What You Will Be Doing
Developing the front end for various components of our point of sale eco-system
Mastering new languages, frameworks, and platforms like Vue.js leveraging AWS
Work in partnership with backend development teams to understand and improve the company’s front-end experience.
Location:
Our offices in Brick or Newark, NJ
Will consider remote
At IDT, we understand the challenge of being apart from those who matter most. Communicating, transferring money, and mobile phone service must be safe, simple, and affordable. Our flagship brand, Boss Revolution, which includes our International Calling, Mobile Top Up, and Money Transfer services, as well as our Boss Revolution Mobile, net2phone, National Retail Solutions, IDT Express, and IDT Carrier Services divisions all, support IDT’s mission of enabling our customers to keep in touch and share resources with their friends and family around the world.
IDT is listed on the NYSE, employs over 1000 people across 20+ countries and has revenues in excess of $1.5 billion. Description:

Participate in the entire software development life cycle including two week Agile SCRUM development Sprints – activities include:
Interfacing with business analysts and clients to refine development requirements
Developing code
Functionally testing fellow developer’s code
Pushing code through development, Integration, Test, Staging and Production environments using GIT
Updating code based on changing requirements
Participating in Sprint meetings (planning sessions, daily stand, up and retrospective)
Assist with programming and coding of specific features within an application upon assignment of a story, support, or bug ticket through the JIRA ticketing system
Test functionality of the application code on multiple browsers based on business and development requirements to ensure code meets agreed upon specifications as well as generate and update testing documents
Assist with the maintenance of data integrity across applications – including inserting, updating and deleting data based on application specifications to ensure continuous data consistency
Must be a team player with multi-tasking, problem solving, and customer service skills
Other similar professional duties as assigned
Requirements:

The ideal candidate will have at least 0-1 years of web development experience with a computer science degree or comparative work experience. Experience with development, maintenance of complex web based business application. Description:

Who We Are...Founded in 1917 as a street corner newsstand in Florence, Alabama, Books-A-Million, Inc. has grown to become the premier book retailing chain in the Southeastern United States, and the second largest book retailer in the nation. Based in Birmingham, Alabama, the company currently operates more than 260 stores in 32 states and the District of Columbia. In addition to its primary retail component, the corporation includes 2nd & Charles-a buy, sell, and trade new and used goods retailer; American Wholesale Book Company (AWBC)- a book wholesale and distribution subsidiary; Joe Muggs Coffee- a coffee and espresso bar operating mostly in Books-A-Million stores; Yogurt Mountain- a self-serve frozen yogurt retailer and franchisor; Preferred Growth Properties (PGP)- an acquisition, design, development, leasing, and management of retail properties; and last but not least, our e-commerce division operating as BOOKSAMILLION.COM.Our mission at Books-A-Million is to take care of our associates, customers, and stakeholders. Our standards are to provide a warm, genuine, and friendly experience, making our customers' needs our first priority. We develop and empower our associates to represent our organization passionately and positively through mutual respect; and we create and maintain an energetic environment that fosters loyalty to our brand. Join the BAM FAM and create a great career.The Position...The Front-End Web Application Developer is responsible for ensuring the alignment of web design and user experience requirements, optimizing web pages for maximum efficiency and maintaining brand consistency across all web pages. The Front-End Web Application Developer must utilize HTML/HTML5, JavaScript, CSS and responsive-site development techniques. LAMP stack programming experience is preferred.The Front-End Web Application Developer is required to work in teams alongside Back-End Developers, Graphic Designers and our ecommerce management team. This position requires excellent communication and interpersonal skills and a high attention to detail.Roles and ResponsibilitiesDevelopment within JavaScript / AJAX, CSS and HTML5, and Responsive Sites.Demonstrated effective verbal and written communication skills required.Compliance to standard IT development processes (SDLC).Full life cycle development: analysis, design, testing and implementation.Must be able to communicate both on a technical level with peers as well as with business teams in a non-technical manner.Qualifications and Education RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field. Who are we?
Thesis, a digital agency in Portland, OR. We’re hell-bent on humanizing the relationship between people and brands, which starts with our teams: real people making real work. Come as you are. Bring what you bring. We’ve been around for 20 years. In contrast to our former identity that reflected what we do, we chose the name Thesis as it better represents how we do it: a full-service agency believing our strength is in our approach—believing how the work we make is only as strong as the thought—and data—we put behind it. That sounds intense. But make no mistake, we also play real hard.

The Junior Developer - Web is an entry level technical position who works directly with the Director of Technology and the Technology team. The Junior Developer - Web supports the Technology team with designing, developing and maintaining various technical projects for our clients needs including websites, web applications, HTML email, and custom software solutions
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Investigate, analyze and make recommendations to the team regarding technology improvements, upgrades and modifications
Participate in team activities such as status meetings and code reviews
Help estimate and plan work during planning meetings
Self-directed learning and study
Create and/or assist in the development of layout of email templates and web experiences by using standard HTML/CSS practices
Write well designed, testable and efficient code by using best development practices
Pair with senior developers to learn advanced skills
Collaborate with partners across disciplines when creating deliverables. EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
1-2 years of professional work experience or other relevant life experience
Any knowledge of computer programming is a plus
KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

Basic knowledge of web technologies and standards is a plus
Proficiency in graphic design tools is a plus
Demonstrated problem identification and creative problem solving skills
Attention to detail and good organizational skills
Ability to work on multiple tasks and switch between them quickly
Excellent time management skills and experience delivering projects in a deadline-driven environment
Critically, be hungry to learn and grow beyond this job description.


Still with us?

Cool! Let’s talk.

———

Workplace equity is not a single checkbox.

It’s a new way of thinking, of working, and of moving through the world. At Thesis, we prioritize diversity, equity, and inclusion. You’ll see this in our hiring practices, growth plans,

and workplace programs—because our agency, our work, and our society are better when diverse perspectives come together.

This Web Developer will be responsible for designing, creating, testing and maintaining web sites and content that are visually pleasing, content rich, with user-friendly interfaces and intuitive navigation that will enrich/optimize the exchange of information and produce effective communications for our customer. You will design, develop, test, and deploy new software solutions and enhancements and provide lifecycle support after the product has been deployed to the production environment. You will interact with teams to gather, define, and analyze requirements to determine the most effective web technologies. You will coordinate creation and collection of necessary technology components and integrate them into a coherent site design.

Experience: Must be a U.S. citizen and currently possess a TS/SCI security clearance with full scope polygraph. A Bachelors degree in a technical discipline is required or 5 additional years of work experience can be substituted for a degree. 4 years of experience as a web developer is required and experience with HTML, Visual Basic, Javascript or other web-based programming languages. Vue.js, React experience is a plus.

Cohesity is on a mission to radically simplify how organizations manage their data to unlock limitless value. We make it easy to back up, manage and derive value from data while protecting data against ransomware attacks. At Cohesity, we're encouraged to think big and we take on dynamic goals that require innovative thinkers. Obsession with our customers keeps us humble and drives us to keep learning.

We've been named a Leader by multiple analyst firms, and are prominently featured in the Forbes Cloud 100 and CRN's Coolest Cloud companies.
Wordpress Web Developer

Location: Remote U.S.

Want to help us simplify the world of data management?
We are looking for an experienced and talented Wordpress Web Developer with a self-starter attitude to help create compelling, efficient, and accessible web experiences to enhance and maintain the Corporate Website, Blog, and international web properties. You will primarily collaborate with other members of Marketing (Web Developers, QA Marketing Operations, and Content production) to deliver great user experiences, and market awareness activities. The role is responsible for full-stack website development and content production/publishing in the WordPress Content Management platform on multiple projects with overlapping timelines.

HOW YOU'LL SPEND YOUR TIME HERE

Develop code to build components, templates, and feature enhancements for our content management system.
Work with web marketers, campaign managers, creative/UX teams, and other functions to develop new capabilities and/or enhance existing capabilities to support business objectives and enhance the desired customer experience.
Transforming visual comprehensive designs into rich web interactions that are fluidly responsive, performant, semantic, and accessible.
Partnering with UX designers, web engineers, analysts, and managers to move a project through development and launch.
Drive day-to-day web development processes, such as code versioning, code reviews, build processes, and deployments.
Drive local content production and publishing needs.
Monitor the daily queue of web change requests and make updates as required.
Deliver timely releases that meet business requirements and stay on budget.
Responsible for ongoing support and maintenance – it will include development, testing, debugging, and applying improvements in a dynamic production environment.

WE'D LOVE TO TALK TO YOU IF YOU HAVE MANY OF THE FOLLOWING

Min 3 years of hands-on experience with website development, content management systems, and web applications.
Expertise in responsive web design and development.
Technical and hands-on expertise in building and deploying web content management solutions including WordPress / Drupal.
Development experience in PHP, HTML5, RESTful web services, JS, Jquery, and modern front-end frameworks.
Extensive experience with WordPress custom page/post templates and development with advanced custom fields or similar plugins.
Update and publish site content in WordPress according to content plans developed by marketing staff and key stakeholders.
Ability to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
Bachelors Degree or Masters in Computer Science or Engineering preferred.
Experience working with US-based Marketing teams.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

NICE-TO-HAVE SKILLS

Experience working directly from design files PSD/XDs to bring responsive front-end web experiences to life via HTML/CSS/JS
Performing cross-browser testing and remediation for front-end and server-side performance with a focus on visual quality control and holistic performance
Experience with Git and GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket
Agile development experience.
Experience in managing content production and publishing needs.
Disclosure Pursuant to Applicable State Equal Pay Transparency Laws - This position has a minimum base salary starting at $80,000.00/year. Bonus, commission (if in a sales function), and/or equity may be eligible for this position. Additionally, full-time employees are eligible for benefits including health and wellness benefits, vacation, paid holidays, 401(k) retirement plan, life and disability insurance coverages, and other benefits the Company may offer from time to time.

We have an open office environment to promote a sense of togetherness and collaboration. UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Primary Responsibilities:
Assisting in the development and maintenance of our Ad Hoc
Follow project guidelines and specifications to creating or modifying content (such as forms, pages and functionality)
Be able to learn any technical/workflow process
Writing codes for tests, pages, files, debugging, and deployment

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
1+ years proven web application administration/development
Experience using JavaScript
Experience working in various environments, such as Azure SQL Server and IIS
Knowledge of SQL or other relational databases
Knowledge of GIT and/or TFS version control
Fluent in JavaScript
Proofreading and attention to detail
Proficiency with multi paradigm programming languages, particularly ASP.NET, C#, Visual Basic, JQuery, JQ Grid, CI/CD and Kendo JS
Preferred Qualifications:
MVC framework experience
IIS experience
Excellent time/project management, problem solving, organizational, and analytical skills

To protect the health and safety of our workforce, patients and communities we serve, UnitedHealth Group and its affiliate companies require all employees to disclose COVID-19 vaccination status prior to beginning employment. In addition, some roles and locations require full COVID-19 vaccination, including boosters, as an essential job function. UnitedHealth Group adheres to all federal, state and local COVID-19 vaccination regulations as well as all client COVID-19 vaccination requirements and will obtain the necessary information from candidates prior to employment to ensure compliance. Candidates must be able to perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation. Failure to meet the vaccination requirement may result in rescission of an employment offer or termination of employment.

Careers at UnitedHealthcare Employer & Individual. We all want to make a difference with the work we do. Sometimes we're presented with an opportunity to make a difference on a scale we couldn't imagine. Here, you get that opportunity every day. As a member of one of our elite teams, you'll provide the ideas and solutions that help nearly 25 million customers live healthier lives. You'll help write the next chapter in the history of health care. And you'll find a wealth of open doors and career paths that will take you as far as you want to go. Go further. This is your life's best work.(sm)
Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $82,100 to $146,900. The salary range for Connecticut / Nevada residents is $90,500 to $161,600. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.
*All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

You'll help write the next chapter in the history of health care. And you'll find a wealth of open doors and career paths that will take you as far as you want to go. Go further. This is your life's best work.(sm)
Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $82,100 to $146,900. The salary range for Connecticut / Nevada residents is $90,500 to $161,600. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.
*All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. UnitedHealthcare is a company that's on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Primary Responsibilities:
Assisting in the development and maintenance of our Ad Hoc
Follow project guidelines and specifications to creating or modifying content (such as forms, pages and functionality)
Be able to learn any technical/workflow process
Writing codes for tests, pages, files, debugging, and deployment

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
1+ years proven web application administration/development
Experience using JavaScript
Experience working in various environments, such as Azure SQL Server and IIS
Knowledge of SQL or other relational databases
Knowledge of GIT and/or TFS version control
Fluent in JavaScript
Proofreading and attention to detail
Proficiency with multi paradigm programming languages, particularly ASP.NET, C#, Visual Basic, JQuery, JQ Grid, CI/CD and Kendo JS
Preferred Qualifications:
MVC framework experience
IIS experience
Excellent time/project management, problem solving, organizational, and analytical skills

To protect the health and safety of our workforce, patients and communities we serve, UnitedHealth Group and its affiliate companies require all employees to disclose COVID-19 vaccination status prior to beginning employment. In addition, some roles and locations require full COVID-19 vaccination, including boosters, as an essential job function. UnitedHealth Group adheres to all federal, state and local COVID-19 vaccination regulations as well as all client COVID-19 vaccination requirements and will obtain the necessary information from candidates prior to employment to ensure compliance. Candidates must be able to perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation. Failure to meet the vaccination requirement may result in rescission of an employment offer or termination of employment.

Think you're smart? We have a logic test and everyone working for us has to ace it. This test does not evaluate your knowledge, only your ability to learn quickly and think logically. Can you pass it?If you're reading this on a computer or device that you have in any way bricked, hacked, modified, customized, disassembled, reassembled, broken, or fixed, then you may be just what Planet Access is looking for.We are looking for another very bright individual to assist us in supporting our clients in the Dallas-Fort Worth area. We are looking for a quick learner. Extensive experience is not required, but an enthusiasm and deep interest in computers and technology is.We build and support networks, servers, and desktop hardware for a range of companies of all different sizes. We also develop custom software, web pages, web applications and mobile apps. Right now we're looking for programmers to help us on our custom software projects and also technicians to help us with our hardware projects, or a little of both if you're interested.The starting pay will be $25 to $30 full or part time and the hours are flexible. Current or graduating students may also apply. We have great benefits, including a matching retirement program available for all employees. For full time positions, we also offer family health insurance at *zero cost to the employee*. There are also significant opportunities for income growth beyond the starting pay.We have been in business for over 40 years and strive for long term relationships with our employees, and we have many clients both large and small in many industries around the Metroplex.We are not specialists in narrow areas﻿. We take on many varied and interesting projects. Working for us is a very stimulating experience and we hardly ever do anything twice.You can visit our website at www.placs.net.Job Types: Full-time, Part-timePay: $25.00 - $30.00 per hourBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingFlexible scheduleHealth insuranceHealth savings accountPaid time offSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayApplication Question(s):What is (or was) your college GPA? job_title: Web Designer / Web Developer / HTML5 Developer
listing_jobDesc:
Location: Torrance, Los Angeles - Department: Web Marketing
Part-time / 1099 unless paired with other skill-set / position
We'd love to see your portfolio!
Instead of just sending us the link to your portfolio, please pick your best three and let us know why they were successful and why you picked them to represent you as Web Designer / Web Developer / HTML5 Developer.
Your skills
Illustrator, Design for web, Photoshop, Flash, InDesign, HTML, CSS, Dreamweaver, Mac & Windows OS, MS Office etc. You should be proficient in more than one of the above skills and learn new ones quickly. If you're the type who will only learn new skills on the job on company time, this isn't the job for you. We need a person who's passionate enough about this already to have picked a lot up on there own and not just someone who wants to try this on as a career is someone else takes makes the effort to educate you.
- How to Apply -
Please add "[ACE] WEB-DEVELOPER-CREATOR-(last name)" to the subject line of your email.

Please include your rates (hour, project etc.)

Your availability

Your favorite (as a designer / developer) website online, and why you think it rocks.
We prioritize local candidates.
NO OFF-SHORE or AGENCIES PLEASE. Seriously, we mean it, ok? Location: Torrance, Los Angeles - Department: Web Marketing

We are looking for a .Net C# Web Programmer/Developer who is passionate about building professional web sites and applications that create a positive brand experience.The programmer/developer will be responsible for all phases of development and will play a significant role in enhancing and improving the user experience across web and application platforms.Seeking a .Net C# programmer/developer who will help us to develop and maintain our in-house proprietary ordering system. This system allows our sales force to build fully customized products from scratch, visually, place and track the orders once they are completed, and provide our sales force with the most up-to-date reporting within their regions. This is a state of the art, one-of-a-kind system with many challenges to push your skills and knowledge of .Net to its limits!ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES1. Ability to develop applications and backend services using C#, ASP.NET, Java Script, jQuery, and CSS. Strong SQL skills are a must.2. Interact regularly with internal users to address issues with current software. Continuously evaluate our ordering system, the Pukka websites, and other digital tools and provide suggestions for improvement.3. Work with and maintain previously developed projects.4. Develop scalable, web-based applications.5. Testing and debugging new code before it is published to end users.6. Diagram and document the processes/programs you have worked on.7. Continually work to stay up to date on current developments and best practices in client-side technologies.QUALIFICATIONS / EDUCATION: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or ability required:1. 2 - 5 Years of experience as a .NET Developer working on Web Application development using C# with .NET 4.0/4.5 Framework or .net core.2. Expertise and hands on experience with Web Applications and programming languages such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, SVG and API's.3. Back-end development utilizing SQL 2008-2012. Candidate needs to have a strong experience with stored procedures, tables and joins.4. Functional knowledge or hands on experience with Web Services (REST, SOAP, etc...) is needed to be successful in this position.5. Working knowledge of graphic design tools such as Sketch, Photoshop, and Illustrator is a plus.6. Must be self-directed and capable of setting priorities independently.7. Willingness to constantly learn new technologies to complete current assignments.8. Must have the ability to thrive in a fast paced, rapidly changing and growing, entrepreneurial environment.9. Ability to communicate clearly and concisely both verbally and with the written word.10. Ability to exercise good judgement and have excellent decision-making and problem-solving skills.Job Type: Full-timePay: $100,000.00 - $140,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payCOVID-19 considerations:Remote acceptable but 1-3 days onsite preferred. Summary

Nextivity is searching for a strong mobile app developer who welcomes both engineering and maintenance tasks. The primary focus will be to implement new user interfaces and features together with unit and integration tests. This role is a one-year, temporary position.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Implement new mobile products, applications, and protocols
Work closely with colleagues to constantly innovate app functionality and design
Use and adapt existing web applications for apps
Write unit atests to identify malfunctions


Skills and Abilities
Develop single-page web apps using React UI framework is required (this covers Javascript, HTML, CSS)
Typescript preferred
SASS preferred
Internationalization (i18next) preferred
Hybrid mobile app development (Apache Cordova, Phonegap, or Capacitor) preferred
Databases (SQLite) preferred
Frontend component library (MUI/Material) preferred
Version control (GIT) preferred
Webpack preferred
Must be able to work under minimal supervision
Must have excellent communication skills; especially electronically
Work Experience
Two years of mobile web app software development.
Education

Bachelors, Computer Science or equivalent Summary
