Provides assistance to the Director of Web Management and Digital Marketing in developing the Murray State website, digital marketing initiatives, and administration of the content management system.
Assists in providing digital content that communicates with prospective students and clients.
Designs and creates content for web according to requirements provided by various stakeholders within the University.
Develops and implements components to support Murray State templates.
Serves as backup for Director of Web Management and Digital Marketing as needed.
Assists the Director of Web Management and Digital Marketing to ensure all website information is compliant with WCAG, accurate and up to date, all links are valid, and all pages reflect branding and content guidelines established by Murray State University.
Assists the branding, marketing and communication team on major marketing and promotional campaigns as needed.
Provides graphic design assistance and develops page designs to support campaigns.
Assists in the implementation of tools to provide tracking and accountability for marketing efforts.
Provides technical support to CMS users.
Assists with Google Tag Manager and Google Analytics set up and monitoring.
Routinely performs quality assurance testing and corrects issues.
Works with Director of Web Management and Digital Marketing to develop new features and page templates in CMS, using XML and XSLT.
Additional duties as assigned.
Minimum Education Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in digital media design, digital marketing, Information Systems communication, graphic design or a related field.
Minimum Experience and Skill Requirements
At least one year of web design or front-end development experience.
Proficiency in HTML and CSS.
Experience designing for compliance with Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)
Ability to identify and correct issues with cross-browser compatibility.
Excellent visual design and layout skills.
Excellent writing, editing and communication skills.
Experience with Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Acrobat Pro, and Adobe Illustrator and designing graphics for web.
Highly motivated/self-starter with a sense of ownership, strong collaboration, and desire to succeed.
Willing to seek out and learn how to implement new technologies and best practices.
Must perform well in a fast-paced environment, balance competing priorities and demonstrate the ability to work without direct supervision.
Ability to create and maintain professional working relationships with others.
Preferred Education and/or Experience Qualifications
Experience in web design/front-end development for Higher Education is preferred.
Proficiency in XML, XSLT development
Experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager
Experience with mobile optimization
Experience with SEO
Understanding of user experience
Experience with website personalization.
Posting Date 07/21/2022 Closing Date Open Until Filled Yes Special Instructions to Applicants
The work location for this position may include on-site, partially remote, or remote
Hourly Rate $20.43 Work Hours
Available to work after normal hours and on weekends as needed when serving as backup for Director of Web Management and Digital Marketing.
Physical Demands For best consideration, please submit a completed application along with all required materials by August 15, 2022. Applications will be accepted until the position is filled.

Overview:

Who we are:
The Lacek Group is a collection of brilliant, passionate, intellectually curious, and unique people who work on the leading edge of customer engagement. We come to work every day to help our clients build longer-lasting, more profitable customer relationships. We listen, collaborate and celebrate together. We treat each other with kindness and respect. And we believe different perspectives drive innovation, fuel creativity and make our business and communities better.
Together with our parent company Ogilvy, one of the most creative and effective agencies in the world, we believe diversity drives smarter work for our clients — and better business for us. We believe inclusion is essential, and we welcome all who are ready to join our push for positive change. Every single day.
What we need
The Associate Front End Developer is responsible for developing digital and web assets including emails, sites, and banners. The day-to-day work will be heavily focused on email development. This role requires no prior professional coding experience and will include the opportunity to work with experienced developers in a mentorship framework.
What you’ll do
Create coded digital assets for world class clients while learning from experienced developers
Manage competing priorities while working on multiple deadline-driven projects
Deliver assets that are in line with client brand standards
Communicate and collaborate with several other functional teams, including Design, Account Management, Data, Application Development, and Quality Assurance
What you’ll bring
A strong desire to learn – no prior professional experience necessary
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
A detail-oriented mindset
An ability to accept, digest and resolve feedback with a positive, can-do attitude
Basic familiarity with front end web technologies (HTML, CSS, Javascript)
Working knowledge of Sketch or Photoshop
Competencies you’ll demonstrate
Adaptability
Agency Citizenship
Collaboration
Communication
Continuous Learning
Managing Work
Stress Tolerance
Technical/Professional Knowledge & Skills

We are a referral-only international design studio with a solid reputation who is looking for a great developer to collaborate with. We have on-going and varied work for great clients so looking for long-term partnership.
We build our sites mainly in Webflow, Squarespace, Wordpress so experience there is a must. The perfect person will also be familiar with no-code automation and have an eye for design.

Are you interested in joining a dynamic and successful marketing team where you can really see the impact of your skills and hard work? Logan Services is growing and adding to our marketing department. We are looking for an energetic, dependable and action oriented individual to join the team!Why Choose Logan?Logan A/C & Heat Services is an incredibly successful HVAC company with a huge passion for our people. What is Invelo?Invelo is a high-velocity SaaS CRM used by real estate professionals. The company was incubated by its sister company, Open Letter Marketing (OLM), which is one of the most respected direct-to-seller marketing companies within the real estate investment industry. Over the last few years, OLM identified a critical unmet need for their real estate investor clients. That need is a unified software platform to find prospects, manage leads and deliver marketing and this is exactly what Invelo does. Moreover, Invelo and OLM work hand-in-hand to create a turnkey servicing solution for real estate investors from start to finish. And, OLM's customer stronghold in this industry creates a consistent pipeline of customers for Invelo and vice-versa.Unique OpportunityAs an early-stage company, Invelo provides an incredible opportunity for employees to directly impact the velocity at which the business grows. Employees will help develop the fundamental building blocks of the business and contribute to the vision of the organization through creativity, desire, and scrappiness. While still in its startup stage, Invelo has gained significant traction that is on track to be one of the most widely used real estate CRMs.Job DescriptionThis is an exclusively front-end engineering role for a Vue.js / PHP / Laraval application. You will be entirely responsible for building pages in HTML/CSS and Vue.js. This role will provide exposure to every aspect of the application. You will have a product lead to provide fully scoped and documented features but you will also use your design skills to develop new, user-friendly workflows. The role reports directly to the Head of Engineering and you will have a significant impact on the overall feature set and architecture of the platform. This will be a fast-paced, demanding position but it will provide you with unparalleled opportunities in a soon-to-be market leader in the real estate industry.You WillOwn the front-end HTML/CSS/Vue.js for the applicationBuild and enhance the application front end Vue.js with Tailwind CSS frameworkWork with product and executive team on UX best practices, designs, and product functionalityWork with a high-performing team who are passionate about what they are buildingDevelop yourself professionally and personally through hard work and getting access to new opportunitiesBonus if you can develop and extend API endpoints for a range of new functionalityRequirements4+ years of experience with JavaScript, HTML, CSS and a JavaScript framework (Vue is strongly preferred)Knowledge of Nuxt, as well as state management with VuexKnowledge and experience with TailwindCSSKnowledge of REST APIsKnowledge of websockets is a plusAn eye for design is a plusExperience in SaaS applications, plus for CRM experienceHighly proficient in implementing front-end UX for complex B2B software applicationsStrong understanding of mobile optimizationExperience using Linux systems. You're comfortable using the command line to troubleshoot issues on a serverExperience with AWS. You've built apps that run and scale in AWSUnderstanding of common web vulnerabilities. You're able to identify vulnerabilities through code reviewsKnowledge of other languages is a strong plusGood English communication skillsOrganized, self-starter, and attention to detail are essential for this roleJob Type: Full-timePay: $120,000.00 - $160,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftApplication Question(s):Confirm that you will be able to work during team hours of Monday-Friday, 9am-5pm EST.Experience:Javascript: 4 years (Required)Vue.js: 4 years (Required)Work Location: Remote What is Invelo?Invelo is a high-velocity SaaS CRM used by real estate professionals. The ideal candidate is a creative problem solver who will coordinate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and maintain our current and next-generation websites and web tools. We are looking for someone to complete our fantastic team.This is an in-person position in Huntsville, Texas.Job Goal: Looking for an experienced or knowledgeable web developer to manage and develop our current website, Eduhero, and assist in developing Eduhero+. Eduhero is an established online, on-demand professional development platform. Serve as technical lead responsible for potential web development needs.While maintaining and developing the current version of Eduhero current, you should expect to work with php, ajax, javascript, and jquery. There may be instances where you will need to fix emerging, deep-seated bugs that have developed over the years or as new features were added. On the topic of new features, we as an ESC work closely with school districts. We respond to their feedback to the best of our abilities, adding new features or further developing old ones to improve functionality. Additionally, you will work closely in the development of Eduhero+.Education: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field qualifications preferred.Major Responsibilities: Full-Stack Development of Eduhero 1.0. Manage Eduhero 1.0. Support the development of www.eduhero.net. Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs. Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability. Follow and uphold best practice design standards for online and on-demand learning. Write well-abstracted, reusable, and efficient code. Leverage industry and technology trends to build new features and products. Ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget. Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders. Willingness to travel.Experience: Designing, developing architecture, and implementing web applications; developing object-oriented applications; responsive design and mobile compatibility standards; React and Build Tools; Sequelize; Expressjs; API architecture and HTTP methods, including building Web APIs; Web Service Models; Search Engine Optimization (SEO) principles preferred; project plan development; HTML/HTML5/XHTML, CSS/CSS3, PHP/MySQL, Javascript; PHP; JQuery; Ajax; best development practices; RDS; full-stack development framework; data analysis.Special Knowledge & Skills Capable of taking the initiative and making recommendations on the best approach. Ability to work on multiple tasks with minimal supervision. Ability and willingness to work independently and as a team member. job_title: Full Stack Web Developer - Entry Level
listing_jobDesc:
Job Description:

Limited Time Opportunity: Earn a $2,000 bonus on your first paycheck on project after completing our in-house training curriculum. For a limited time. Ask for more details.

This Full-Stack Web Developer position will be working on client’s software projects to help assess, design, and implement to ensure a successful project completion. This role begins with an on site training program with curriculum designed to sharpen and test your programming abilities. Upon successful completion of training, you will have a clearer understanding of creating enterprise REST Endpoints, complex Full-Stack web applications, and advanced coding proficiency.


Successful candidates of the training program are currently working on projects in the following areas: Java SpringBoot back end, Node.JS React front end, building sophisticated graphical user interfaces (GUI), managed DevOps infrastructure as well as Big Data. When on project, our software developers solve technical challenges, document solutions, resolve bugs, and allocate resources to deliver solutions for the client.


We are looking for people to participate in our in-office training for this position as soon as September 12th.

Requirements:
Basic fundamentals of coding concepts or languages such as Java, Python, JavaScript, or equivalent
Ability to understand basic computer terminology and identify hardware and peripherals
Ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts and maintain professional interpersonal skills in a corporate environment
Successful completion of a background check and drug screen
Must own a reliable vehicle for transportation
Ability to drive to and train on site in our Minneapolis office
Training Includes:
Full time (40hrs/week) paid training
Professional development in-house: formal skill-based training, rigorous preparation for future projects, and developmental relationships
Collaborative team environment with peers and mentors every step of the way
Hands on access to state-of-the-art technology from our preferred vendors
1-on-1 mentorship with highly skilled Senior Developers to sharpen your skills
Perks and Benefits:
Pay starts at $25/hour after completing our 3-month paid training program
$2,000 bonus on you first paycheck on project
Up to 16% raises at scheduled checkpoints/ merit-based reviews
Excellent Health, Dental, Vision, and 401(k) with employer match program
7 Paid Federal Holidays
Accrue up to 2 weeks PTO annually after first year on project
Certification Reimbursement (example: AWS Cloud Developer, Oracle Certified Java Professional)

listing_jobDesc: We are looking for a php developer for a custom built php web program that manages technician's labor and client billing.Flexible options for working are available as well as various compensation strategies. We can offer a salary and benefits, or we can pay a percentage of the volume of traffic through the site to incentivize performance. The latter is preferred (presumably by both parties.) Our current programmer for this project is now partnered with Cook Technology Corp. in a new business and would like to delegate this project since it is operational and tested for over a year.You can work from home, if you like, but occasional company meetings are likely to be required. We work in and with VR and AR, but since this is a critical role, where we are looking for a long term solution, preferably a partnership, we want someone we can meet with as needed.In 3 to 5 years we will invite an ideal programmer to partner with us with a C level promotion and shares in the company.we would like a candidate with 2-5 years experience with php in commercial environments.You will want to be near Jacksonville Florida.You should have a passion for helping people with technology.You will work closely with Bill Cook. Who is Beast Code?

Beast Code began in 2014 as a few friends with a dream to transcend the traditional defense solution paradigm. Today, we are a workforce of more than 140 beasts headquartered in Fort Walton Beach. Our projects continue to grow as we build better solutions for our clients and drive the next wave of software development and technology on the Emerald Coast of Florida.

Beast Code is Tenacious, Resourceful, Collaborative, Passionate, and Disruptive. These qualities ensure that Beast Code exceeds expectations and develops meaningful applications.
 Benefits:

Medical, Dental, Vision (60% of premium paid by company)
HSA / FSA Medical Plans
401K with 6% Company Match
Unlimited PTO
Observes all federal holidays including a week off for Christmas
Maternity Leave (6 weeks)
Paternity Leave (3 Weeks)
Professional Development ($1200 annual allowance)
Pay Transparency
Flexible Work Schedule
Remote Work


Pay Bands:

Web Developer 1: $59k to $73k
Web Developer 2: $75k to $93k
Web Developer 3: $92k to $111k
Web Developer 4: $111k to $133k
Web Developer 5: $126k to $154k


Web Developer

If Beast Code is a laboratory of innovative software projects, then we are looking for brilliant scientists. As our project pipeline continues to grow, we’re looking to add web developers who are passionate about programming and eager to create applications that make a difference in people’s lives.


Beast Code is transforming the software industry in Northwest Florida. As our project pipeline continues to grow, we’re looking to add software engineers who are passionate about programming and eager to create applications that break the mold and set new standards.
Our clients say the groundbreaking software solutions Beast Code builds are like a jar of awesome sauce. But we know the truth and recognize that our crafty coders (that’s you) are the secret ingredient.


Beast Code fosters a collaborative work environment that encourages thinking outside the box for solutions. We value teamwork and prefer developers who play well with others and thrive as part of a team of engineers, designers, product owners, scrum officers and other stakeholders.


Our projects run the gamut from game-based learning programs for defense contracts to 3D model solutions for commercial clients. That means there is always engaging work to do creating and optimizing great code that goes on to become industry disrupting applications! Do you have what it takes to be a Beast?

This job might be for you if you are familiar with and enjoy:

Code repositories (i.e. GitHub, GitLab, etc.)
Task management tools (i.e. Jira)
Documentation suites (i.e. Confluence, Markdown, Mermaid)
Researching solutions using resources such as StackOverflow
Reviewing existing solutions using code snippets and libraries
Keep current with software development industry standards/trends to keep company on the cutting edge


You should bring these skills to the table:

Can comfortably work within one or more programming language, framework or platform (i.e. JavaScript, TypeScript, Vue, Vite, Webpack, Python, and .NET)
Understand, and are comfortable with, the basics of SQL databases
Can implement basic user stories with minimal or no support

Have an analytical ability to troubleshoot and debug issues


You score Bonus Points if you:

Have the ability to set up a developer environment
Can identify and make architectural improvements
Are comfortable documenting code and develop unit/regression tests
Enjoy executing code reviews
Can identify and utilize the appropriate framework/language for a project
Optimize code and improve performance of applications


Other Requirements:

Due to the nature of our work, it is mandatory that you are a U.S. Citizen and able to comply with Government regulations.
Ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret security clearance.
Successfully complete background check and maintain a valid USA driver’s license
Beast Code is a drug free work environment using mandatory pre-employment drug testing and random drug testing as per all applicable laws


Beast Code is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Beast Code does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.
After submitting be sure to check your SPAM folder for messages from BambooHR, as all of our correspondence will come from here. Who is Beast Code?

SunPlus Data Group is looking for a Web Engineer to work for a State Government facility in Columbia, SC.

This is for 12 months to start and is likely to extend

Hours are generally M-F, 40 hrs/week

Pay is $73/hr W2 hourly (NO CTC)

**(THIS POSITION IS 100% ON-SITE TO TRAIN/WORK FOR A FEW MONTHS. POSSIBLY REMOTE AFTERWARDS UP TO 75%. NO GUARANTEES. MANDATORY, NO EXCEPTIONS)**

It usually takes the State Government about 1-3 weeks to start interviews, just so that you are aware of the timeframe. The first interview will usually be via phone or WebEx.

Job Summary:

The State of SC is seeking a Web Engineer with documented experience. The Web Engineer will SUPPORT SCDMV APPLICATION DEVELOPMENT OF NEW BUSINESS FUNCTIONS AND TROUBLESHOOTING WITHIN THE SCDMV APPLICATION FRAMEWORK.

APPLICATIONS INCLUDE SCDMV PHOENIX II CLIENT AND WEB SERVICES, IIS WEB SERVICE TRANSACTIONS, EXTERNAL BUSINESS-TO-BUSINESS WEB SERVICE DESIGN, ENHANCEMENT, AND SUPPORT AND SUPPORT OF INTERFACES TO 3RD PARTY SYSTEMS.
SOME PRODUCTION TROUBLESHOOTING SUPPORT WILL BE EXPECTED, SO PRODUCTION SUPPORT EXPERIENCE IS DESIRABLE. THE ENGINEER WILL BE TASKED WITH SUPPORTING SEVERAL SCDMV BUSINESS FUNCTIONS AND BUSINESS AREAS.

DAILY DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. ANALYZE THE SCDMV PHOENIX II AND WEB APPLICATIONS

2. TAKE THE LEAD IN ANALYZING AND TROUBLESHOOTING ASSIGNED SYSTEM PROBLEMS

3. PROPOSE SOLUTIONS

4. CODE, TEST, PROMOTE AND INTERACT WITH IMPACTED USERS ENSURING THAT SOLUTION MEETS

REQUIREMENTS

Who We are

BairesDev is proud to be the fastest-growing company in America. With people in five continents and world-class clients, we are only as strong as the multicultural teams at the heart of our business. To consistently deliver the highest quality solutions to our clients, we only hire the Top 1% of the best talents and nurture their professional growth on exciting projects.
We are looking for SQL Developers to work from home and join our Development team and participate in different projects made up of multicultural teams distributed throughout the world. We are looking for proactive people, team players passionate about programming in this language and oriented to provide the best experience to the end user. This is an excellent opportunity for those professionals looking to develop in one of the fastest growing companies in the industry! These developers will face numerous technical challenges, so they must use current technologies, get involved in the mobile world, web applications, devices, etc.
Main Activities:
Solve complex integration problems and ensure that best practices are followed.
Diagnose complex setups, and communicate clearly through its resolution.
Build internal tools for automation and foster a collaborative environment.
Identify process improvements, come up with solutions and coordinate efforts with other leaders and key partners.
Identify and triage system-issues and work with our development team to drive resolution.
Build relationships with outside vendors and partners including tag management solutions, analytics, etc.
Facilitate new hire training and onboarding.
What are we looking for:
5+ years of experience in SQL Development and 6 years working as a developer.Proficient with analysis, troubleshooting, and problem solving.Hands-on experience with managing data loads and data quality.Advanced English level.
How we do make your work (and your life) easier:
100% remote work.Hardware setup for you to work from home.
- Flexible hours - make your schedule.
Paid parental leave, vacation & holidays.Diverse and multicultural work environment.An innovative environment with the structure and resources of a leading multinational.Excellent compensation — well above the market average.Here you can grow at the speed of your learning curve.
Our people work remotely but with a consistent and robust culture that promotes diversity and teamwork. To continue being the leading software development company in Latin America, we want to ensure that every BairesDev member gets the best growth and professional development opportunities in a diverse, welcoming, and innovative environment.

Every BairesDev team member brings something unique to our company.

Description:

MBL Technologies, Inc. offers a diverse set of technology and management consulting services to the Federal government and commercial markets. Our custom solutions are tailored to support each client’s mission, accounting for their unique needs and operating environments to maximize effectiveness and ensure success. We bring the right people, capabilities, and experience to bear to enable informed decision-making and solutions that deliver our clients the value necessary to enable the mission.
Why Work With Us?
We trust, empower, and believe in our employees to soar to their fullest potential! No micromanaging here!
We offer a robust benefits package (medical, dental, vision, STD, Accident, Life, Hospital Insurance, FSA, HSA, 401K match, professional development stipend, etc.).

Description:

At Westminster College, we believe in immersive and enriching experiences that inspire creative thinking and problem solving. We believe in creating opportunities for several different paths to success over a lifetime and the potential to make an impact from wherever you are. For our students, we do this by providing real-world, hands-on learning opportunities, small class sizes, and talented professors dedicated to the individual. Our employees often remark that our tight-knit community creates an atmosphere fostering campus involvement that adapts to all interests. As a result, Westminster continues to be recognized for its excellence in higher education as one of the best small liberal arts colleges in the Midwest.
 The Web Developer is responsible for the coding, design translation and content management of college’s web services, from concept all the way to completion from the bottom up, fashioning everything from the home page to site layouts and functions.
Requirements:

Essential Functions
 Improve website architecture, content and linking to improve SEO positions for target keywords.
Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices.
Create website UX/UI by using standard HTML/CSS practices.
Integrate data from various back-end services and databases.
Build internal tools and customer-facing solutions to support key marketing initiatives.
Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs.
Create and maintain software documentation.
Work with application support teams to ensure timely issue resolution and thorough support processes.
Maintain, expand and scale college’s web services.
Utilize your Dev Ops skills to provide efficient, streamlined, and secure deployments.
Stay abreast of emerging technologies/industry trends and apply them into operations and activities.
Translate creative concepts and designs provided by designers into web content and landing pages.
Take design templates created by designers and match visual design intent.
Maintain website content utilizing Cascade, WC’s content management system.
Monthly web meetings with key people on campus to ensure website accuracy.
Provide benchmark and tracking reports on SEO positions, traffic, conversions and other metrics.
Be a ‘Thought Leader’ and partner with college leaders.
Direct digital measurement through use of landing pages, Google analytics and cookie tracking.
Analyze website architecture, content, linking and factors to identify opportunities for SEO.
Stay up-to-date with current technologies and trends in design tools and applications.
Work closely with Information Technology Department.
Additional duties as required.
Job Requirements:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics, marketing or related field.
Experience: At least two years of experience working in a technical environment, desired. At least two years of experience in web application programming and development, desired
Skills:
Demonstrated analytical, technical, computer, web and digital marketing skills.
Top-notch programming skills and in-depth knowledge of modern HTML/CSS.
Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model.
Experience with one or more front end frameworks such as Angular, React or Vue
 Experience consuming RESTFUL APIs.
Understanding of how web applications work including security, session management, and best practices.
In-depth knowledge of Search Engine Optimization techniques.
Aggressive problem diagnosis and creative problem-solving skills.
Ability to juggle multiple tasks within the constraints of timelines and budgets with business acumen.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly and master diverse web technologies.
Knowledge of relational database systems and web application development.
Knowledge of and/or ability to learn content management systems, such as Cascade.
Excellent communication skills.
Technical knowledge of SEO, Google Analytics, Google Programmable Search, including PHP, SQL, XML, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, HTTP, URL structures, keyword analysis, content optimization and other factors that impact SEO. Knowledge of with CMS, such as Cascade, WordPress and Velocity preferredThis is an on-campus position.
Review of applications will begin immediately and will continue until the position is filled or the search is closed.
Westminster College encourages and gives full consideration to all applicants for admission, financial aid, and employment. The College is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. 501 Westminster Ave, Washington West, 2nd floor
Fulton, MO 65251

573-592-5226 Description:

At Westminster College, we believe in immersive and enriching experiences that inspire creative thinking and problem solving. We believe in creating opportunities for several different paths to success over a lifetime and the potential to make an impact from wherever you are. For our students, we do this by providing real-world, hands-on learning opportunities, small class sizes, and talented professors dedicated to the individual. Our employees often remark that our tight-knit community creates an atmosphere fostering campus involvement that adapts to all interests. As a result, Westminster continues to be recognized for its excellence in higher education as one of the best small liberal arts colleges in the Midwest.
 The Web Developer is responsible for the coding, design translation and content management of college’s web services, from concept all the way to completion from the bottom up, fashioning everything from the home page to site layouts and functions.
Requirements:

Essential Functions
 Improve website architecture, content and linking to improve SEO positions for target keywords.
Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices.
Create website UX/UI by using standard HTML/CSS practices.
Integrate data from various back-end services and databases.
Build internal tools and customer-facing solutions to support key marketing initiatives.
Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs.
Create and maintain software documentation.
Work with application support teams to ensure timely issue resolution and thorough support processes.
Maintain, expand and scale college’s web services.
Utilize your Dev Ops skills to provide efficient, streamlined, and secure deployments.
Stay abreast of emerging technologies/industry trends and apply them into operations and activities.
Translate creative concepts and designs provided by designers into web content and landing pages.
Take design templates created by designers and match visual design intent.
Maintain website content utilizing Cascade, WC’s content management system.
Monthly web meetings with key people on campus to ensure website accuracy.
Provide benchmark and tracking reports on SEO positions, traffic, conversions and other metrics.
Be a ‘Thought Leader’ and partner with college leaders.
Direct digital measurement through use of landing pages, Google analytics and cookie tracking.
Analyze website architecture, content, linking and factors to identify opportunities for SEO.
Stay up-to-date with current technologies and trends in design tools and applications.
Work closely with Information Technology Department.
Additional duties as required.
Job Requirements:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics, marketing or related field.
Experience: At least two years of experience working in a technical environment, desired. At least two years of experience in web application programming and development, desired
Skills:
Demonstrated analytical, technical, computer, web and digital marketing skills.
Top-notch programming skills and in-depth knowledge of modern HTML/CSS.
Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model.
Experience with one or more front end frameworks such as Angular, React or Vue
 Experience consuming RESTFUL APIs.
Understanding of how web applications work including security, session management, and best practices.
In-depth knowledge of Search Engine Optimization techniques.
Aggressive problem diagnosis and creative problem-solving skills.
Ability to juggle multiple tasks within the constraints of timelines and budgets with business acumen.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly and master diverse web technologies.
Knowledge of relational database systems and web application development.
Knowledge of and/or ability to learn content management systems, such as Cascade.
Excellent communication skills.
Technical knowledge of SEO, Google Analytics, Google Programmable Search, including PHP, SQL, XML, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, HTTP, URL structures, keyword analysis, content optimization and other factors that impact SEO. Knowledge of with CMS, such as Cascade, WordPress and Velocity preferredThis is an on-campus position.
Review of applications will begin immediately and will continue until the position is filled or the search is closed.

An exciting opportunity now exists to join BOXX Technologies! We are searching for an enthusiastic, hard-working, motivated, and driven .NET Web Developer to drive the evolution of our websites, here in Austin, TX. This job will require the qualified candidate to effectively communicate the quality of our products, and the pride we take in building them. You’ll work closely with our Marketing, Sales, and Product Management teams to keep our website at the cutting edge of technology. This full-time position reports to the Manager of Information Systems.
Responsibilities include:
Developing websites, landing pages, and other assets using best in class HTML/CSS practices
Designing and writing high quality C# and JavaScript code, with an emphasis on maintainability and standards
Modifying C# and Razor code in existing CMS platform to accommodate new front-end designs
Assist with e-commerce product maintenance, configurator design and uptime.
Assisting in the management and deployment of web tracking codes, scripts and other items
Gathering and refining specifications and requirements based on technical needs
Planning and executing user research, usability testing, and optimization testing
Measuring, identifying and removing any barriers to online order conversion, increasing conversion rates
Skills and Abilities:
Strong communications and relationship management skills
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and meet deadlines
Ability to take the initiative and follow through
Ability to work both independently and within a cross-functional team
Position Requirements:
Experience with JavaScript, C#, and HTML
0-2 years of web development and programming experience
Proficiency in Microsoft Office
Top-notch programming skills and in-depth knowledge of modern HTML/CSS
Experience designing sites for use on both desktop and mobile
BOXX Technologies Offers:
Industry competitive base salary and quarterly bonus potential ($55K-$65K annually)

Various group insurance choices, matching 401(k) plan, and a paid time off (PTO) plan
About BOXX:
BOXX is the leading innovator of high-performance workstations and rendering systems for visual effects, animation, product design, engineering, architecture, and more. Combining record-setting performance, speed, and reliability with unparalleled industry knowledge, BOXX is the trusted choice for creative professionals worldwide.
Here's YOUR opportunity to capitalize on a genuine career opportunity! If you are a motivated, high energy individual who is looking to take the next step in your career, please apply!
BOXX is an Equal Opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.
BOXX is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please email jobs@boxx.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. listing_jobDesc:
Salary Range: $20.00 - $34.00 (USD) Hourly
Work Location: Coquille, OR (REMOTE WORK NOT AVAILABLE)
First Community is a growing organization seeking employees that can develop and maintain websites and web-based technologies. Skills required are: Good PC/data entry skills, exceptional attention to details, and knowledge of programming language fundamentals. This position requires the individual to have a strong knowledge of Version control systems (GIT), HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX, VueJS Framework. Knowledge of back end languages is helpful, but not required.
GitHub/Code examples highly recommended.
Benefits:
401(k) with 50% employer match
Company Paid Health insurance
Competitive Wages
Vacation, Sick, Personal Pay
On the job training offered

Granite Background & History
Granite is one of the premier communications services provider to businesses across the United States and Canada. We provide exceptional customized service with an emphasis on reliability and outstanding customer support and our customers include over 85 of the Fortune 100. Granite has over $1.65 billion in revenue with more than 2,200 employees and is headquartered in Quincy, MA just off I-93 and directly next to the North Quincy T Station on the Red Line. Our mission is to be the leading telecommunications company wherever we offer services as well as provide an environment where the value of each individual is recognized and where each person has the opportunity to further their growth and achieve success.
Granite has been recognized by the Boston Business Journal as one of the “Healthiest Companies” in Massachusetts. Our Quincy office has an onsite dining facility and a fully equipped state of the art gym that offers daily Cross Fit, Mixed Martial Arts, and Yoga classes available to employees at zero cost.
Granite’s philanthropy is unparalleled with over $200 million in donations to organizations such as Dana Farber Cancer Institute, The ALS Foundation and the Alzheimer’s Association to name a few.
We have been rated a “Fastest Growing Companies” by Inc. Magazine past ten consecutive years in a row (2007-2016).
If you are a highly motivated individual who wants to grow your career with a fast paced and progressive company, Granite has countless opportunities for you.
EOE/M/F/Vets/Disabled
General Summary of Position:
GRANITE TELECOMMUNICATIONS
Office Location: Quincy, MA (HQ)
JOB NOTICE

Position Title: Web Developer II
Position Description: Hours: 40 hrs per wk.
 9:00 AM– 5:00 PM
Work with Development Team and Business Analysts to create user friendly web applications for customers to

APPLICANTS FOR THIS POSITION SHOULD REPORT TO THE EMPLOYER, NOT THE LOCAL EMPLOYMENT SERVICE OFFICER AT: GRANITE TELECOM LLC, ATTN: LISA MUI, ESQ., 100 NEWPORT AVE EXT., QUINCY, MA 02171.

. Granite Background & History
Granite is one of the premier communications services provider to businesses across the United States and Canada. We provide exceptional customized service with an emphasis on reliability and outstanding customer support and our customers include over 85 of the Fortune 100. Granite has over $1.65 billion in revenue with more than 2,200 employees and is headquartered in Quincy, MA just off I-93 and directly next to the North Quincy T Station on the Red Line. Our mission is to be the leading telecommunications company wherever we offer services as well as provide an environment where the value of each individual is recognized and where each person has the opportunity to further their growth and achieve success.
Granite has been recognized by the Boston Business Journal as one of the “Healthiest Companies” in Massachusetts. Our Quincy office has an onsite dining facility and a fully equipped state of the art gym that offers daily Cross Fit, Mixed Martial Arts, and Yoga classes available to employees at zero cost.
Granite’s philanthropy is unparalleled with over $200 million in donations to organizations such as Dana Farber Cancer Institute, The ALS Foundation and the Alzheimer’s Association to name a few.
We have been rated a “Fastest Growing Companies” by Inc. Magazine past ten consecutive years in a row (2007-2016).
If you are a highly motivated individual who wants to grow your career with a fast paced and progressive company, Granite has countless opportunities for you.

Who We are

BairesDev is proud to be the fastest-growing company in America. With people in five continents and world-class clients, we are only as strong as the multicultural teams at the heart of our business. To consistently deliver the highest quality solutions to our clients, we only hire the Top 1% of the best talents and nurture their professional growth on exciting projects.
We are looking for SQL Developers to work from home and join our Development team and participate in different projects made up of multicultural teams distributed throughout the world. We are looking for proactive people, team players passionate about programming in this language and oriented to provide the best experience to the end user. This is an excellent opportunity for those professionals looking to develop in one of the fastest growing companies in the industry! These developers will face numerous technical challenges, so they must use current technologies, get involved in the mobile world, web applications, devices, etc.
Main Activities:
Solve complex integration problems and ensure that best practices are followed.
Diagnose complex setups, and communicate clearly through its resolution.
Build internal tools for automation and foster a collaborative environment.
Identify process improvements, come up with solutions and coordinate efforts with other leaders and key partners.
Identify and triage system-issues and work with our development team to drive resolution.
Build relationships with outside vendors and partners including tag management solutions, analytics, etc.
Facilitate new hire training and onboarding.
What are we looking for:
5+ years of experience in SQL Development and 6 years working as a developer.Proficient with analysis, troubleshooting, and problem solving.Hands-on experience with managing data loads and data quality.Advanced English level.
How we do make your work (and your life) easier:
100% remote work.Hardware setup for you to work from home.
- Flexible hours - make your schedule.
Paid parental leave, vacation & holidays.Diverse and multicultural work environment.An innovative environment with the structure and resources of a leading multinational.Excellent compensation — well above the market average.Here you can grow at the speed of your learning curve.
Our people work remotely but with a consistent and robust culture that promotes diversity and teamwork. To continue being the leading software development company in Latin America, we want to ensure that every BairesDev member gets the best growth and professional development opportunities in a diverse, welcoming, and innovative environment.

Every BairesDev team member brings something unique to our company.

Our company, National Retail Solutions (NRS), is a wholly-owned subsidiary of IDT Corporation – a telecom company with many products and divisions including its famed Boss Revolution international calling products sold in 10’s thousands of stores, and its Net2Phone Office hosted PBX offering.
NRS is revolutionizing the independent retail industry by providing them with cost-effective, state of the art point sale systems and complementary services such as a store management app, consumer ordering app, web storefront for merchants, and loyalty programs allowing small retailers to more effectively compete with the larger store chains and online merchants. We are deployed in well over 14 thousand stores across the US at this time.
The technology division is a small, high-powered development group with teams situated in the US, Israel, and Minsk that produces interactive, high-performance web applications that are both good-looking and easy to use.
Our development team is in search of a candidate to develop the front ends of several of our applications, both for customer-facing and internal websites.
Required Skills & Experience
Professional experience in a frontend or full-stack development role
Professional experience with a modern JavaScript framework (e.g. Vue, Angular, React) - Vue.js preferred
Serves as a client advocate to implement a user-friendly experience
Ability to work effectively both individually and in a team environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including producing wireframe mockups
Ability to interact professionally with a diverse group: clients, executives, managers, and coworkers
Working knowledge of AWS services
Experience with GitHub, Jira
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
What You Will Be Doing
Developing the front end for various components of our point of sale eco-system
Mastering new languages, frameworks, and platforms like Vue.js leveraging AWS
Work in partnership with backend development teams to understand and improve the company’s front-end experience.
Location:
Our offices in Brick or Newark, NJ
Will consider remote
At IDT, we understand the challenge of being apart from those who matter most. Communicating, transferring money, and mobile phone service must be safe, simple, and affordable. Our flagship brand, Boss Revolution, which includes our International Calling, Mobile Top Up, and Money Transfer services, as well as our Boss Revolution Mobile, net2phone, National Retail Solutions, IDT Express, and IDT Carrier Services divisions all, support IDT’s mission of enabling our customers to keep in touch and share resources with their friends and family around the world.
IDT is listed on the NYSE, employs over 1000 people across 20+ countries and has revenues in excess of $1.5 billion. We are ExtraHop. ExtraHop is on a mission to help you take it back with security that can't be undermined, outsmarted, or compromised. Our dynamic cyber defense platform, Reveal(x) 360, helps organizations detect and respond to advanced threats––before they compromise business operations. We apply cloud-scale AI to petabytes of traffic per day, performing line-rate decryption and behavioral analysis across all infrastructure, workloads, and data-in-flight. WHO WE ARE

Biofire Technologies is on a mission to give gun owners better tools for reducing preventable gun injuries and deaths, especially among children. We believe our technology, combined with a best-in-class customer experience, will define the future of firearms safety for the next generation. Our mission-driven approach has earned support from the firearm community, the tech world, and the media.

Biofire employees are world-class engineers who have designed and tested firearms, medical devices, robots, cars, satellites, rockets, and supersonic jets. What unites our team is our commitment to safety and reliability that we bring to our work every day.


OUR CULTURE

Reducing accidental firearm injuries and deaths requires original thinking and authentic collaboration, so we’re deeply invested in building a team and culture that can achieve our mission together. Team members enjoy autonomy and flexibility from day one, so expect to be immediately tasked with solving challenging problems and building new systems that work. We’ll hold you accountable for executing on audacious goals, giving and receiving honest feedback, and helping your teammates succeed. You’ll receive respect, kindness, and support from every direction while you figure out how to get it all done.


ABOUT THE ROLE

As a Full Stack Web Developer at Biofire you will be responsible for building and maintaining Biofire’s web properties, including our primary website Biofire.io. You will be responsible for Biofire’s digital “front window”, owning the development, performance, and effectiveness of our web-based customer engagement. You will work iteratively across teams to build custom features and bring new ideas to life, all in service of deepening Biofire’s ability to engage with our customers through our web platforms.

To succeed you will need to be an expert in modern front- and back-end web architecture and development, and adept at working with non-technical users to implement feature ideas in a performant, easy-to-maintain way. You will need to be a curious problem-solver, rapidly learning Biofire’s business objectives and challenges and contributing your technical acumen to address them via our web platform. You will work quickly on multiple priorities at once, and will draw on your excellent communication and prioritization skills. As the development team grows, your teammates will rely on your clean, well-documented code to continue extending the platform.

If you are excited about advancing Biofire’s mission by creating web platforms that deeply engage our customers, we encourage you to apply.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Day to day responsibilities of the role will include:

Owning the development, performance, and iteration of Biofire’s web properties, especially our primary website, Biofire.io;
Developing deeply engaging custom features, beyond the limits of traditional CMS platforms, including dynamic content pages, customer-specific engagement paths, and A/B testing infrastructure to support continuous iteration;
Owning, managing, and continuously improving website environments (Dev, Staging, and Prod), Biofire’s full-stack website toolset, and all third party integrations;
Ensuring comprehensive website security, proactively maintaining patches and upgrades to mitigate vulnerabilities;
Continuously improving site performance, ensuring uptime and minimizing performance impact on SEO;
Working with teams across Biofire to build new web functionality that engages our customers in new and better ways.


COMPENSATION, BENEFITS & PERKS

We’ll need you to bring your very best, so we give you what you need to do a great job. You’ll enjoy flexible hours, teammates you will like, respect, and be inspired by, and all the technical resources you might need at our Broomfield office.

In addition to our competitive pay and stock options, Biofire offers fully covered medical, dental, and vision benefits, a funded Health Spending Account, unlimited PTO (that team members actually use - we promise), a 401(k) with employer matching, and a 14 week parental leave policy. We deliver perks including noise-canceling headphones, the premium music streaming service of your choice, and anything else you’d need to succeed in your role (within reason).

This is a full-time, salaried role with a flexible work-from-home policy. The compensation range for this role is $100K - $150K.


QUALIFICATIONS

If you think you will succeed in this role, and love the work you’ll do, we encourage you to apply regardless of your background. We evaluate candidates based on their unique talents and fit for our needs, not a rigid list of qualifications.


LOCATION AND HOURS

Our dog-friendly, state-of-the-art headquarters is located in beautiful Broomfield, Colorado, between Boulder and Denver. Most roles require team members to frequently collaborate in person, but you will enjoy the flexibility to work from home when you need to. We trust you to communicate with your team to make things work.


DIVERSITY & INCLUSION

We’re bringing innovation to a technological problem that has persisted for decades, so we depend on diverse, inclusive, and collaborative teams to break new ground and do great work. We welcome people from all qualified backgrounds, and we don’t discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, political affiliation, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.


ELIGIBILITY

This role handles information subject to US Export Control Regulations. Applicants must be (a) a citizen of the United States; (b) a lawful permanent resident of the United States (“Green Card” holder); or (c) a person admitted into the United States as an asylee or refugee to be considered for the position. We’ll need you to bring your very best, so we give you what you need to do a great job. You’ll enjoy flexible hours, teammates you will like, respect, and be inspired by, and all the technical resources you might need at our Broomfield office.

In addition to our competitive pay and stock options, Biofire offers fully covered medical, dental, and vision benefits, a funded Health Spending Account, unlimited PTO (that team members actually use - we promise), a 401(k) with employer matching, and a 14 week parental leave policy. We deliver perks including noise-canceling headphones, the premium music streaming service of your choice, and anything else you’d need to succeed in your role (within reason).

This is a full-time, salaried role with a flexible work-from-home policy. The compensation range for this role is $100K - $150K.


QUALIFICATIONS

If you think you will succeed in this role, and love the work you’ll do, we encourage you to apply regardless of your background. We evaluate candidates based on their unique talents and fit for our needs, not a rigid list of qualifications.


LOCATION AND HOURS

Our dog-friendly, state-of-the-art headquarters is located in beautiful Broomfield, Colorado, between Boulder and Denver. Most roles require team members to frequently collaborate in person, but you will enjoy the flexibility to work from home when you need to. We trust you to communicate with your team to make things work.


DIVERSITY & INCLUSION

We’re bringing innovation to a technological problem that has persisted for decades, so we depend on diverse, inclusive, and collaborative teams to break new ground and do great work. We welcome people from all qualified backgrounds, and we don’t discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, political affiliation, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.


ELIGIBILITY

This role handles information subject to US Export Control Regulations. Applicants must be (a) a citizen of the United States; (b) a lawful permanent resident of the United States (“Green Card” holder); or (c) a person admitted into the United States as an asylee or refugee to be considered for the position. WHO WE ARE

Biofire Technologies is on a mission to give gun owners better tools for reducing preventable gun injuries and deaths, especially among children. We believe our technology, combined with a best-in-class customer experience, will define the future of firearms safety for the next generation. Our mission-driven approach has earned support from the firearm community, the tech world, and the media.

Biofire employees are world-class engineers who have designed and tested firearms, medical devices, robots, cars, satellites, rockets, and supersonic jets. What unites our team is our commitment to safety and reliability that we bring to our work every day.


OUR CULTURE

Reducing accidental firearm injuries and deaths requires original thinking and authentic collaboration, so we’re deeply invested in building a team and culture that can achieve our mission together. Team members enjoy autonomy and flexibility from day one, so expect to be immediately tasked with solving challenging problems and building new systems that work. We’ll hold you accountable for executing on audacious goals, giving and receiving honest feedback, and helping your teammates succeed. You’ll receive respect, kindness, and support from every direction while you figure out how to get it all done.


ABOUT THE ROLE

As a Full Stack Web Developer at Biofire you will be responsible for building and maintaining Biofire’s web properties, including our primary website Biofire.io. You will be responsible for Biofire’s digital “front window”, owning the development, performance, and effectiveness of our web-based customer engagement. You will work iteratively across teams to build custom features and bring new ideas to life, all in service of deepening Biofire’s ability to engage with our customers through our web platforms.

To succeed you will need to be an expert in modern front- and back-end web architecture and development, and adept at working with non-technical users to implement feature ideas in a performant, easy-to-maintain way. You will need to be a curious problem-solver, rapidly learning Biofire’s business objectives and challenges and contributing your technical acumen to address them via our web platform. You will work quickly on multiple priorities at once, and will draw on your excellent communication and prioritization skills. As the development team grows, your teammates will rely on your clean, well-documented code to continue extending the platform.

If you are excited about advancing Biofire’s mission by creating web platforms that deeply engage our customers, we encourage you to apply.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Day to day responsibilities of the role will include:

Owning the development, performance, and iteration of Biofire’s web properties, especially our primary website, Biofire.io;
Developing deeply engaging custom features, beyond the limits of traditional CMS platforms, including dynamic content pages, customer-specific engagement paths, and A/B testing infrastructure to support continuous iteration;
Owning, managing, and continuously improving website environments (Dev, Staging, and Prod), Biofire’s full-stack website toolset, and all third party integrations;
Ensuring comprehensive website security, proactively maintaining patches and upgrades to mitigate vulnerabilities;
Continuously improving site performance, ensuring uptime and minimizing performance impact on SEO;
Working with teams across Biofire to build new web functionality that engages our customers in new and better ways.


COMPENSATION, BENEFITS & PERKS

We’ll need you to bring your very best, so we give you what you need to do a great job. You’ll enjoy flexible hours, teammates you will like, respect, and be inspired by, and all the technical resources you might need at our Broomfield office.

In addition to our competitive pay and stock options, Biofire offers fully covered medical, dental, and vision benefits, a funded Health Spending Account, unlimited PTO (that team members actually use - we promise), a 401(k) with employer matching, and a 14 week parental leave policy. We deliver perks including noise-canceling headphones, the premium music streaming service of your choice, and anything else you’d need to succeed in your role (within reason).

This is a full-time, salaried role with a flexible work-from-home policy. The compensation range for this role is $100K - $150K.


QUALIFICATIONS

If you think you will succeed in this role, and love the work you’ll do, we encourage you to apply regardless of your background. We evaluate candidates based on their unique talents and fit for our needs, not a rigid list of qualifications.


LOCATION AND HOURS

Our dog-friendly, state-of-the-art headquarters is located in beautiful Broomfield, Colorado, between Boulder and Denver. Most roles require team members to frequently collaborate in person, but you will enjoy the flexibility to work from home when you need to. We trust you to communicate with your team to make things work.


DIVERSITY & INCLUSION

We’re bringing innovation to a technological problem that has persisted for decades, so we depend on diverse, inclusive, and collaborative teams to break new ground and do great work. We welcome people from all qualified backgrounds, and we don’t discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, political affiliation, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

About the Company
Are you interested in working in an environment that fosters creativity and innovation? Do you desire to work for a company that encourages growth and new ideas? If so, eDOC Innovations is the right fit for you.
Based in Middlebury, VT, eDOC Innovations is recruiting a Software Developer with the drive to succeed and the ability to be a productive and positive member of our team. eDOC Innovations is dedicated to becoming the premier provider of Mobile Digital Transaction Management (mDTM) solutions for credit unions. Designed to meet the changing needs of today's business environment, our software products and systems will deliver the industry's foremost adaptive solution at a great price. eDOC provides a competitive wages, benefits and up to 11 paid federal holidays.
Summary
This individual is responsible for building, testing, and maintaining a wide range of software applications. These include but are not limited to web pages, interfaces, services, schedule tasks, and desktop applications. This role will require knowledge in consuming RESTful API resources, interacting with SQL databases, and coding modular units that can be utilized by other applications. This position will require skill in coordinating efforts with other developers, design team, and operations team to build successful solutions. eDOC Innovations has built a vast array of products over the last 20 years, and part of the responsibilities of this position will include becoming familiar with these existing solutions to resolve deficiencies and enhance their features.

Job Functions
Build software that meets defined technical requirements and match prototypes created by the design team
Produce modular code that can be integrated into other solutions
Troubleshoot and resolve deficiencies and implement enhancements in existing products
Use a configuration management system to perform version control, storage, and retrieval of source code
Produce initial product documentation, including product descriptions, instructions for use, and test methods
Provide estimates of work required to complete specific tasks
Maintain a current working knowledge of applicable industry standards, best practices, and emerging technologies
Coordinate efforts with other developers and departments
Provide technical assistance to senior management, Quality Control, Sales, Marketing, and Documentation teams
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in computer science, or similar technical degree, or equivalent job experience required.
Functional knowledge and coding experience in web development including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, PHP, etc.
Familiarity with producing and consuming RESTful interfaces.
Functional knowledge in creating back-end services including data storing, processing, and SQL interactions.
Most of our services and desktop applications are programmed in Delphi. Familiarity with Delphi, Java, C#, or similar object-oriented language is required.
Ability to troubleshoot, fix, and enhance existing solutions.
Familiarity with CVS, GIT, or other source control software.
Strong communication skills in speaking and writing, and a propensity to coordinate with others in development efforts.
Ability to comply with appropriate safeguards and procedures when dealing with sensitive or confidential data.
Complete background check process. About the Company

Description:

Why Altair?
Altair Data Resources, Inc. is a consumer and credit marketing data company helping clients to target high-propensity customer prospects and develop and execute a data driven marketing strategy. We have a passion for the success and satisfaction of our clients and employees. Our core focus is leveraging technology to provide convenient access to industry-leading data, data processing, and analytics for marketing. At Altair, we believe clients are our purpose, we can do it with a positive attitude and teamwork, and we can do it better with our measurable improvement and innovation.
This opportunity allows you to make an immediate impact as part of a small, but highly effective team.
We work hard and play hard! Enjoy social events throughout the year including holiday parties, monthly birthday celebrations, and gifts on employment anniversaries.
Work life balance is a priority. We offer our employees generous paid time off and unparalleled flexibility around working hours.
 Software Developer Job Description
Altair Data Resources is seeking a Software Developer who is looking for an opportunity to work in an entrepreneurial, high-growth, enthusiastic environment. You will gain significant experience within our Development Team, helping to both maintain and improve existing processes as well as develop new ones. To be considered for this position, you must have demonstrated experience in the areas described in the following sections.
Objectives of Software Developer Role
Write clean, efficient code with complete documentation.?
Periodically audit existing data integration methods?
Develop API connectors as needed?
Gather and refine technical project scope?
Develop enhanced documentation in user guides, FAQs, etc.?
Monitor new development technologies and methods?
Work with management to prioritize projects?
Communicate effectively with internal staff and clients?
Requirements:
Software Developer Work Experience
At least 1 year of experience
Bachelor of Science Degree
Software Developer Qualifications and Skills
Object Oriented Programming
Full Stack Development
PHP
Python (including SQLAlchemy, Django, NumPy/Pandas, package management)?
Data Management and Optimization with Microsoft SQL Server
Responsive web design (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap)?
DevOps with git integration? Description:

Who is Beast Code?

Beast Code began in 2014 as a few friends with a dream to transcend the traditional defense solution paradigm. Today, we are a workforce of more than 140 beasts headquartered in Fort Walton Beach. Our projects continue to grow as we build better solutions for our clients and drive the next wave of software development and technology on the Emerald Coast of Florida.

Beast Code is Tenacious, Resourceful, Collaborative, Passionate, and Disruptive. These qualities ensure that Beast Code exceeds expectations and develops meaningful applications.
 Benefits:

Medical, Dental, Vision (60% of premium paid by company)
HSA / FSA Medical Plans
401K with 6% Company Match
Unlimited PTO
Observes all federal holidays including a week off for Christmas
Maternity Leave (6 weeks)
Paternity Leave (3 Weeks)
Professional Development ($1200 annual allowance)
Pay Transparency
Flexible Work Schedule
Remote Work


Pay Bands:

Web Developer 1: $59k to $73k
Web Developer 2: $75k to $93k
Web Developer 3: $92k to $111k
Web Developer 4: $111k to $133k
Web Developer 5: $126k to $154k


Web Developer

If Beast Code is a laboratory of innovative software projects, then we are looking for brilliant scientists. As our project pipeline continues to grow, we’re looking to add web developers who are passionate about programming and eager to create applications that make a difference in people’s lives.


Beast Code is transforming the software industry in Northwest Florida. As our project pipeline continues to grow, we’re looking to add software engineers who are passionate about programming and eager to create applications that break the mold and set new standards.
Our clients say the groundbreaking software solutions Beast Code builds are like a jar of awesome sauce. But we know the truth and recognize that our crafty coders (that’s you) are the secret ingredient.


Beast Code fosters a collaborative work environment that encourages thinking outside the box for solutions. We value teamwork and prefer developers who play well with others and thrive as part of a team of engineers, designers, product owners, scrum officers and other stakeholders.


Our projects run the gamut from game-based learning programs for defense contracts to 3D model solutions for commercial clients. That means there is always engaging work to do creating and optimizing great code that goes on to become industry disrupting applications! Do you have what it takes to be a Beast?

This job might be for you if you are familiar with and enjoy:

Code repositories (i.e. GitHub, GitLab, etc.)
Task management tools (i.e. Jira)
Documentation suites (i.e. Confluence, Markdown, Mermaid)
Researching solutions using resources such as StackOverflow
Reviewing existing solutions using code snippets and libraries
Keep current with software development industry standards/trends to keep company on the cutting edge


You should bring these skills to the table:

Can comfortably work within one or more programming language, framework or platform (i.e. JavaScript, TypeScript, Vue, Vite, Webpack, Python, and .NET)
Understand, and are comfortable with, the basics of SQL databases
Can implement basic user stories with minimal or no support

Have an analytical ability to troubleshoot and debug issues


You score Bonus Points if you:

Have the ability to set up a developer environment
Can identify and make architectural improvements
Are comfortable documenting code and develop unit/regression tests
Enjoy executing code reviews
Can identify and utilize the appropriate framework/language for a project
Optimize code and improve performance of applications


Other Requirements:

Due to the nature of our work, it is mandatory that you are a U.S. Citizen and able to comply with Government regulations.
Ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret security clearance.
Successfully complete background check and maintain a valid USA driver’s license
Beast Code is a drug free work environment using mandatory pre-employment drug testing and random drug testing as per all applicable laws


Beast Code is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Beast Code does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Role: Dotnet Developer
Primary Location: Raleigh, NC (3 days a month on-site)
Duration: 24-48 months
Salary: $55-60/Hr on W2
The expertise you bring:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a technology-related field (e.g., Engineering, Computer Science, etc.) required
5+ years of experience in .NET
5+ years of experience in Angular, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript and building responsive web applications
5+ years of experience in RESTful APIs or another web service
3 – 5 years of experience in SQL, PL-SQL
Familiarity with Python is a plus
Familiarity with ETL (Informatica) is a plus
Experience in agile methodologies (Kanban and SCRUM)
The skills you bring:
Strong technical design and analysis skills
Ability to deal with ambiguity and work in a fast-paced environment
Excellent communication skills, both through written and verbal channels
Excellent collaboration skills to work with multiple teams in the organization
Ability to understand and adapt to changing business priorities and technology advancements
Solid understanding and technology trends in implementing business applications
A great teammate and able to mentor junior team members
The Value you deliver:
Crafting, building, and supporting mission-critical solutions for applications to provide the best customer experience
Exploring new technology trends and leveraging them to simplify and modernize our ecosystem
Driving Innovation and influencing the team to implement solutions with future thinking
Collaborating with internal and external teams to deliver technology solutions for the business needs
Guiding teams to improve development agility and productivity
Resolving technical roadblocks to the team and mitigating potential risks
Delivering system automation by setting up continuous integration/continuous delivery pipelines
Acting as a technical mentor to the team and bringing them up to speed on the latest data technologies and promoting continuous learning
What are the top must-have skills (experience candidates must have coming in the door)?
.NET (only) C#
Angular version8 + is a must-have skill
SQL as a must-have skill
They need someone who can collaborate and understands cloud deployment
They are upgrading legacy applications to new versions and hosting them on the cloud. That includes UI and API development.
They will take any cloud experience, azure or AWS. Role: Dotnet Developer
