Job Title : - Web DeveloperLocation : - Remote Duration : - Long TermOverviewThe Application Development Team at Consumers Energy supports a large majority of our Business Areas’ application needs. We use agile processes to manage our work pipeline. We are a pooled team of resources which increases every developer’s opportunity for exposure into new areas and technologies that are utilized within our company. We work together to share knowledge of applications and business areas to be our company’s best resource for their application needs.The team’s scope includes technical analysis, design, code development, unit testing, defect resolution and support. The team works within defined company and department standards and has a focus on internal customer service. The team delivers secure, and quality applications using a broad set of core capabilities that extend across multiple technology stacks, including but not limited to: Microsoft .NET, web technologies (HTML/CSS/JavaScript), SAP ABAP, PO, CRM, SharePoint,Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI), TIBCO ESB, BizTalk, Redwood, ISIS Papyrus, BI Data, Python, memSQL, DataServices, and ServiceNow.The team primarily utilizes a hybrid agile format delivering enhancements and new applications. The team is comprised of resources with expertise in many technology stacks across multiple portfolios.Key responsibilities include:· Analyze business problems, identify technology options, and define detailed specifications of technology solutions according to company standards and guidelines; develop technical specifications using functional and/or business requirements as a starting point· Perform technical analysis and refine system requirements and designs· Identify, develop, deploy, and provide post implementation support of application technologies to support the company’s business requirements· Applies principles, methods, and procedures for designing, developing, optimizing, and integrating new and/or reusable system components· Perform prototyping, design, development, testing, debugging, documentation and implementation of software applications in an agile environment· Design and develop efficient and effective applications through optimal use of reusable components· Ensure that applications are optimized for state‐of‐the‐art technology and functionality, comply with regulatory requirements, and are consistent with the current and planned infrastructure and data environments· Design and document user interfaces· Work with business/system analysts, Quality Assurance and the business partners to test applications; assure software and systems quality and functionality, i.e. meets documented business requirements· Integrate hardware and software componentsRequirements/QualificationsExperienced with customcode development through work or school assignmentsA bachelor's degree in a related field of study: Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems or other IT-related areaThe following skills and experience will set you apart from others:· Microsoft .Net· ESRI/ArcGIS· Python· TIBCO ESB· Data Analytics· Data Services/BODs· memSQL· Azure API Management Tool· Azure DevOps and/or Git· Fiori/UI5· Web technologies such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript/Angular/React· Agile software development· Utility/Energy industry background that includes a working knowledge of effectively mapping technology to business challenges· Demonstrates understanding of the system development life cycle· Experienced one or more full project / product release cycles· Experienced using software development tools and software configuration management (SCM)· Understanding of software test methodologies, test scripting and testing tools· Understanding of database management principles and methodologies, including data structures, data modeling, data warehousing, and transaction processing· Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a collaborative team environment· Self-motivation to operate with a high degree of autonomy· Proven knowledge of software design principles, methods, and approaches, mastery of, and skill in applying, systems engineering concepts and factors, such as: structured design, supportability, survivability, reliability, scalability, and maintainability· Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities· Proven ability to work effectively in a team setting as well as independentlyThanks & Regard Nazar Hasan603, Capitol Ave, Suite 310 A461, Cheyenne Wyoming 82001Direct: (815) 365-6749Job Type: ContractSalary: $50.00 - $60.00 per hourSchedule:8 hour job_title: Full Stack Web Developer - Entry Level
listing_jobDesc:
Job Description:

Limited Time Opportunity: Earn a $2,000 bonus on your first paycheck on project after completing our in-house training curriculum. For a limited time. Ask for more details.

This Full-Stack Web Developer position will be working on client’s software projects to help assess, design, and implement to ensure a successful project completion. This role begins with an on site training program with curriculum designed to sharpen and test your programming abilities. Upon successful completion of training, you will have a clearer understanding of creating enterprise REST Endpoints, complex Full-Stack web applications, and advanced coding proficiency.


Successful candidates of the training program are currently working on projects in the following areas: Java SpringBoot back end, Node.JS React front end, building sophisticated graphical user interfaces (GUI), managed DevOps infrastructure as well as Big Data. When on project, our software developers solve technical challenges, document solutions, resolve bugs, and allocate resources to deliver solutions for the client.


We are looking for people to participate in our in-office training for this position as soon as September 12th.

Requirements:
Basic fundamentals of coding concepts or languages such as Java, Python, JavaScript, or equivalent
Ability to understand basic computer terminology and identify hardware and peripherals
Ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts and maintain professional interpersonal skills in a corporate environment
Successful completion of a background check and drug screen
Must own a reliable vehicle for transportation
Ability to drive to and train on site in our Minneapolis office
Training Includes:
Full time (40hrs/week) paid training
Professional development in-house: formal skill-based training, rigorous preparation for future projects, and developmental relationships
Collaborative team environment with peers and mentors every step of the way
Hands on access to state-of-the-art technology from our preferred vendors
1-on-1 mentorship with highly skilled Senior Developers to sharpen your skills
Perks and Benefits:
Pay starts at $25/hour after completing our 3-month paid training program
$2,000 bonus on you first paycheck on project
Up to 16% raises at scheduled checkpoints/ merit-based reviews
Excellent Health, Dental, Vision, and 401(k) with employer match program
7 Paid Federal Holidays
Accrue up to 2 weeks PTO annually after first year on project
Certification Reimbursement (example: AWS Cloud Developer, Oracle Certified Java Professional)

Last Updated: Aug 05, 2022 Job Description:

Limited Time Opportunity: Earn a $2,000 bonus on your first paycheck on project after completing our in-house training curriculum. For a limited time. Ask for more details.

This Full-Stack Web Developer position will be working on client’s software projects to help assess, design, and implement to ensure a successful project completion. This role begins with an on site training program with curriculum designed to sharpen and test your programming abilities. Upon successful completion of training, you will have a clearer understanding of creating enterprise REST Endpoints, complex Full-Stack web applications, and advanced coding proficiency.


Successful candidates of the training program are currently working on projects in the following areas: Java SpringBoot back end, Node.JS React front end, building sophisticated graphical user interfaces (GUI), managed DevOps infrastructure as well as Big Data. When on project, our software developers solve technical challenges, document solutions, resolve bugs, and allocate resources to deliver solutions for the client.


We are looking for people to participate in our in-office training for this position as soon as September 12th.

Requirements:
Basic fundamentals of coding concepts or languages such as Java, Python, JavaScript, or equivalent
Ability to understand basic computer terminology and identify hardware and peripherals
Ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts and maintain professional interpersonal skills in a corporate environment
Successful completion of a background check and drug screen
Must own a reliable vehicle for transportation
Ability to drive to and train on site in our Minneapolis office
Training Includes:
Full time (40hrs/week) paid training
Professional development in-house: formal skill-based training, rigorous preparation for future projects, and developmental relationships
Collaborative team environment with peers and mentors every step of the way
Hands on access to state-of-the-art technology from our preferred vendors
1-on-1 mentorship with highly skilled Senior Developers to sharpen your skills
Perks and Benefits:
Pay starts at $25/hour after completing our 3-month paid training program
$2,000 bonus on you first paycheck on project
Up to 16% raises at scheduled checkpoints/ merit-based reviews
Excellent Health, Dental, Vision, and 401(k) with employer match program
7 Paid Federal Holidays
Accrue up to 2 weeks PTO annually after first year on project
Certification Reimbursement (example: AWS Cloud Developer, Oracle Certified Java Professional)

Join a dynamic and collaborative IT Department that drives the growth of a successful, mature company that has the creativity of a start-up. You will be part of the team that facilitates billions of dollars of U.S. and U.K. exports shipped overseas annually. Global trade is a hot topic and this position is right in the middle of developing products and services that capitalize on that trend.

Being part of a small and nimble team means you will learn fast and have immediate opportunities to grow. Curiosity, collaboration and commitment will earn advancement quickly.

We are currently looking for a Junior Web Developer to join our Development Team. Kernow Capital Corporation a.k.a. boomerang carnets, is a leader in ATA Carnets, customs guarantees, surety bonding and marine insurance. We are expanding within our specialized niche and want new people and ideas to be a part of our expansion into new technologies.

As the Jr. Web Developer, you will:

Program web applications and systems that support Users’ needs.
Create applications, data structures and related queries that interface with accounting and other ERP systems.
Support state-of-the-art customer portals and production tools.
Troubleshoot, debug, and optimize code for performance & security.

Your professional growth opportunities, experience and knowledge will be many and varied including:

ASP.Net
Network technologies
Web systems
Data architecture development
Microsoft Dynamics and Related Microsoft technologies.

Core Requirements (Internship experience accepted.)

1-2 years Information Systems experience including ASP.NET, VB.NET, HTML on Microsoft platforms.
VB.NET Experience.
SQL Server 2005 Development Experience (T-SQL, SSIS).
Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio 2008.
Minimum Associates Degree in Computer Science.

Extra Consideration:

BS Degree, Information Technology-related.
Formal Training in VB technology.
LAN IP configuration and maintenance in multi-subnet environment (DNS, DHCP, WINS).
Familiarity with 3rd party tools i.e. Telerik & Crystal Reports.
Front end development tools: CSS, Browser compatibility.
Experience with SQL Server Enterprise Manager/Query Analyzer.

Boomerang carnets’ philosophy supports a pleasant and supportive work environment that makes it fun to come to the office. Perks and benefits include:

Medical, dental and vision insurance.
Annual bonus program that rewards employees based on corporate and individual performance. Bonuses are up to 10% of salary.
401(k) plan with employer contribution that doesn’t require an employee contribution – we give you a 401(k) account and put 3% of your salary into the account annually that is immediately, 100%, vested. Essentially everyone gets an additional 3% of their salary given to them in their retirement account.
All new employees receive on-premises training including a personalized training plan where appropriate.
External company-sponsored training and education is available when appropriate or necessary. The company will pay for all or part of certifications and licensing assuming it is a component of an approved professional development plan for the employee.
Paid time off includes vacation, sick and personal days
Company-provided beverages including soft drinks, coffee and tea.
Spacious and comfortable outdoor break area for summer lunches and breaks.
Company-sponsored BBQs, parties, breakfasts and meals at least once a month.
Annual Employee Appreciation Event typically including an outing and gifts for the staff. Examples include wine tasting, concerts, museums and escape rooms.
Annual Holiday Party typically with an elaborate meal and entertainment.

Annual salary is $40,000 - $48,000 depending upon experience. A $250 signing bonus is available.

Relocation services or relocation compensation are not available. Independent contractors are not being considered for this position. Must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer.

Title: Web Developer/DesignerReports To: Agency DirectorDo you like to live wild? Do you have a passion for the outdoors? Charge Media Partners, a digital marketing leader within the HUNTING & FISHING marketplaces, is “on the hunt” for a Web Developer & Designer.The “Must-Haves” We are Looking For:Passion for all things outdoors – hunting, fishing, shooting, camping, etc. Don’t bother applying if you’ve never stood over a gut pile, smelled a smoking barrel, lipped a largemouth or woke up under the stars.Extensive experience in: JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and programming applications.Someone able to manage time and prioritize.If the above resonates with you, we'd like to talk. Please apply via resume and cover letter.Company Profile: Located in Canton, GA, Charge Media Partners is a full service social, digital & content marketing firm, specializing in the Hunting, Shooting and Outdoor Industries nationwide. Through segmented digital distribution and the development of creative content, Charge Media Partners serves as a valuable marketing resource to a wide variety of well-known outdoor brands.Responsibilities: The Web Developer & Designer is responsible for developing and/or designing websites for our clients. You will be working alongside a team in creating, maintaining, and updating websites. In order for you to succeed in this role, you will need to be proficient in JaveScript, HTML, CSS, and have solid knowledge and experience in programming applications. The following represents a list of typical duties:Website and software application designing, building, or maintaining.Using scripting or authoring languages, management tools, content creation tools, applications, and digital media.Conferring with teams to resolve conflicts, prioritize needs, develop content criteria, or choose solutions.Directing or performing Website updates.Developing or validating test routines and schedules to ensure that test cases mimic external interfaces and address all browser and device types.Editing, writing, or designing Website content, and directing team members who produce content.Maintaining an understanding of the latest Web applications and programming practices through education, study, and participation in conferences, workshops, and groups.Back up files from Web sites to local directories for recovery.Identifying problems uncovered by customer feedback and testing and correcting or referring problems to appropriate personnel for correction.Evaluating code to ensure it meets industry standards, is valid, is properly structured, and is compatible with browsers, devices, or operating systems.Determining user needs by analyzing technical requirements.Requirements: Must be passionate about the outdoors (Hunt, Fish, Shoot and Camp).Bachelor's degree in Web development or related field, or relevant experience.Solid knowledge and experience in programming applications.Proficient in JavaScript, HTML, CSS.Proficient in My SQL.Dedicated team player.Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.Solid ability in both written and verbal communication.Knowledge of programming language and technical terminology.Able to develop ideas and processes and clearly express them.High degree of independent judgment.Able to solve complex problems.Cognitive Requirements: Excellent command of the English language with strong oral and written communication skills.Effective analytical and problem-solving skills.Resourceful and creative with strong interpersonal skills.Independent work style with strong organization and time management skills.Ability to take projects from conception to completion without direct supervision.Ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks while maintaining superior attention to detail.Positive attitude and customer oriented.Demonstrated ability to understand project objectives and meet deadlinesAppreciation for and ability to maintain high level of confidentialitySalary: Compensation to be commensurate with experience.Job Types: Full-time, ContractIndeed Questions: We have Description:

MBL Technologies, Inc. offers a diverse set of technology and management consulting services to the Federal government and commercial markets. Our custom solutions are tailored to support each client’s mission, accounting for their unique needs and operating environments to maximize effectiveness and ensure success. We bring the right people, capabilities, and experience to bear to enable informed decision-making and solutions that deliver our clients the value necessary to enable the mission.
Why Work With Us?
We trust, empower, and believe in our employees to soar to their fullest potential! No micromanaging here!
We offer a robust benefits package (medical, dental, vision, STD, Accident, Life, Hospital Insurance, FSA, HSA, 401K match, professional development stipend, etc.).
